reviews.text: (COVID take-out experience)<br><br>I had nothing better to do while waiting for my spouse to carry out some work, so I came across the mall and treated myself to a snack.<br><br>My intention was to get a slice of cheesecake, but after looking at the menu, the soup of the day sounded appealing, so I ordered a bowl.  I ordered online and was told to wait in the parking lot.  I was texted when my order was ready and then I was told to pull into the valet and my order would be brought to my car.  That experience was time-saving.<br><br>When I arrived at my hotel, I noticed my order didn&#39;t include any plasticware.  I washed my previously used stuff in the sink so I could eat since the hotel didn&#39;t have any for me to use.<br><br>I was given bread and butter with my soup.  It was placed in the same bag as my soup, so the butter melted.  To make things worse, some &#34;genius&#34; thought it was appropriate to wrap butter in foil without any protection.  The butter leaked all over the inside of the bag and made for a greasy mess.  Why not put it in a little condiment cup?  The soup didn&#39;t meet my expectations and was disappointed in the lack of flavor.  The cheesecake was okay.<br><br>The reason for my low rating is the butter issue.  It was inconvenient and I had to do additional cleaning in my hotel room to spare my hotel housekeep additional work.
Really great service and good food. Can&#39;t beat the service here. Our waitress, Jessica,  was absolutely on her game and we were not a small party! Took great care of all of us!

Disappointing experience. I ordered take out for my family tonight and we ended up tossing most of it. The spring rolls were swimming in oil and they were burnt. The pasta tasted bland, not how it normally tastes (I always order this dish) Please train your kitchen staff better.

This location is usually pretty good but this past weekend I decided to order takeout and order a strawberry cheesecake. I eat a couple of bites, then I see that one of the strawberries has MOLD on it. (Picture Attached). I will not order from this location again.<br><br>BEWARE OF THE MOLD

Terrible service. The loaded potato soup tasted like loaded ass. The server was terribly rude as well as the manager. Literally the server acted as though he didn&#39;t want to be there. There are plenty of people who want to work, if you don&#39;t want to work and serve people stay home. Please spend your money elsewhere! I will not be back.

Came here today for late lunch on a rainy day. We were seated rather quickly and served by a nice gentleman. He was diligent and on top of our orders. Soft spoken and polite.<br><br>I&#39;ve always loved CF, and today was no exception except today I ordered from the skinny menu. Shrimp &amp; lemon angel hair, at only 500 calories. When it came, it was small. I had initially thought that the skinny version was a lighter version i.e. the preparation but it was literally much much smaller than the standard serving. It was still very good no doubt about that but was disappointed. Anyway, I will still come back to CF as I&#39;ve always enjoyed my meal here.

Just ruined my babies 10th birthday dinner!! All the food was disgusting including the appetizers and everything was cold!!! The beverages my husband and I ordered basically had no alcohol in them!!! Due to social distancing you could see other tables where other people left full plates of food as well!!! The Cumberland location doesn&#39;t even deserve 1 star!! Guess I have to fly back to California to enjoy Cheesecake Factory smh

They seated up quickly, but everything after that was so slow. It took about 45 minutes to get our food and then over a half hour to get a slice of cheesecake to go without a single visit from our waiter. Use to love coming here, but this experience has the really ruined this place. <br><br>Update: the service was awful when we went so this time we decided to just do takeout. Parts of our orders were changed without letting us even know. It was a different pasta on one dish and the side was different on the other than we got last time and from what was on the description. It just really shows this place does not care about the experience or their customers.

The worst experience I&#39;ve ever had in a restaurant and I&#39;m over 70 years old. Sunday July 26 I call to see if meatloaf was on the menu and was on hold until I got to the restaurant, about 30 minutes. I went inside and placed a take order. There was a bench open that had signs that said social distance . Since no one else was sitting I thought it was ok for my husband and I sat. After a few minutes the manager Amy came up to us and said we have to go outside and wait that section was closed. She said those distance signs means closed. I said the sign should say closed and there would be no confusion. I went to the ladies room and when I was leaving I noticed only one person at the bar so I decided to have a drink. The same social distance signs were on the bar so I asked if your open and the bartender said yes. A few minutes later a couple sat at the bar also. Ms Amy decided that I should leave because my seat was to close to the couple , she could have asked them to move over , why me ? My food was still not ready so  she said she is going refund my food order but not my drink and she would be calling security for me to leave. I&#39;ve never been kicked out of anywhere . I hope this review was helpful for management so this never happens to anyone else. Ms Amy needs training on how to to listen and be polite to her customers. I will still support Cheesecake but not that location as long as Amy is still a manager there.
This host is a rude dawg face ass lil bitch that has a bad ass attitude I would never come to this ghetto establishment ever I would suggest y&#39;all to go to another location

Placed an order for mobile curb side. After sitting outside for 15 minutes I went inside to see (while it was pouring down rain) what was taking so long. They told me they did not have my order and made me walk back out to my car in the pouring rain to get my phone so I could show them the order confirmation. After walking back inside they told me that they had given my food out to someone else.. it has now been over an hour since I placed my order and all they offered me was a slice of cheesecake or a full refund.. Obviously I want my food still but I think it&#39;s ridiculous that all I got in return for waiting over an hour was a free slice of cheesecake.. I don&#39;t even like cheesecake that much. All that being said, the manager was very nice that I dealt with but I think the company policy should be changed when dealing with their own mistakes. Very unhappy about what happened and will not be back.<br><br>Update: it has now been almost 2 hours since I placed my order and I am still waiting outside for my food. Worst experience ever<br><br>Update no.2: After speaking to the manager Jared again,  who was very nice, we asked what else could be done because 2 hours to wait for take away dinner is ridiculous. He informed me that I could receive a $25 gift card by mail. Overall I&#39;m still not the happiest, considering that this isn&#39;t even half the price of the food that I&#39;m still paying for, the company at that point should&#39;ve given a full refund. Any restaurant I&#39;ve worked in (which has been many) would&#39;ve done the same. I will not be back to this location again.

Food was delicious, I ordered the vegan burger and it was seasoned perfectly.  First time trying it and would recommend it for anyone. They have a great selection of teas and look the box it come out in to choose from. Waiter was awesome, very patient and knowledgeable of menu. Made great recommendations. Very busy place, so expect to wait at least 20 minutes on the weekend, and wait for good to come out. Great time to converse while waiting.

Food was delicious like always. My favorite right now is the Louisiana Chicken Pasta. It has a little kick but isn&#39;t too overpowering. I placed a to-go order and found out that you could order a lunch size for this which is great because everyone knows their portions or huge (which I&#39;m definitely not complaining about lol). The lunch portion was still enough for me to split over two meals. The food came out hot and packaged well. <br><br>I also got a slice of salted caramel cheesecake. Mouth watering. Loved every bit of it. <br><br>Downsides: The prices are high and *close* parking can be difficult to find at this location. Also, two staff members ignored me when I walked in. It wasn&#39;t until the third staff member walked by me that someone actually offered to assist me.

I&#39;m so disappointed... I&#39;m 6 months pregnant and was craving the Louisiana pasta and the crab and artichoke dip. I had my boyfriend drive 45 mins to get me this food while I waited at home so excited because I just knew it was going to be amazing!!!! This food wasn&#39;t cheap and being pregnant I can&#39;t go out we are in the middle of a pandemic... This was the blandest, most dry bow tie pasta ever. The pasta has no sauce. Crab dip was good but the bread was so hard it could not be eaten... I called and called at abt 8 pm no answer. So I called the next day and spoke with Preston who told me to bring the food back so he could coach is staff!!! It&#39;s the next day! The food is in the trash Preston!!! Not to mention you want me to bring it back so you can handle it in the middle of a coronavirus outbreak? Horrible food horrible customer service!
As always Cheesecake Factory does a great job with the food and service, look forward to going back again

Server was very condescending throughout our entire lunch. Whenever we ordered something he would either make a noise insinuating he didn&#39;t want us to order that or flat out tell us to order something else. The things he did recommend we ended up not even liking. Waited 15 minutes for drinks in an almost empty dining room. My boyfriend ordered two items one of which was a burger &amp; he didn&#39;t get the burger until we were halfway done eating. The fries for the burger didn&#39;t come out until another 10 minutes later &amp; they were stale.

Tonight was the absolute worst service I have EVER had in my entire life. First, we showed up at 6:30 on a Saturday night so I knew the wait would probably be an hour. The host told us an hour and a half which I was okay with because it was our son&#39;s 14th birthday and he really wanted to go there for his first time. Our table wasn&#39;t ready for over two hours. Once we were finally seated, the server we had was TERRIBLE. Cold bread, no plates, and drinks from the bar took 40 minutes. Once the food finally came out, it was DISGUSTING! My husband&#39;s food arrived to the table cold, I had a piece of burnt pasta in my plate, and my friend&#39;s pasta was so over cooked you could literally pick up the enter dish with her fork. Not to mention the $8 strawberries that my 4 year old nephew asked for as his side that came AFTER the check was paid. One manager Brian was an absolute waste of space. We complained to him our frustrations and he claimed he would take care of us. He NEVER came back to the table. I give one star for the amazing professional manager who assisted me by the name of Allison I. She deserves 10 stars and every bit of the tip that the unprofessional waitress received. She was apologetic from the very beginning when our table took longer than it was supposed to. I literally caught her as she was about to leave with her coat and purse on. She took care of us and was sweet, respectful, and caring. Due to the fact that our son&#39;s first experience was poor, we will not be returning. Based on our service, this restaurant deserves ZERO STARS! However, Allison deserves 10!!

I&#39;m not sure what&#39;s been going on lately or if it&#39;s just been my bad luck but i have had yet another dining disaster. <br><br>Disclaimer: i very much so like the chessecake factory. <br><br>Upon sitting at the table, i realized rather quickly that every piece of silverware dirty.. like DIRTY. I wish i was able to snap a photo before the server took them. Anyways, i requested plastic for the table. The server Josh was dope and had no problem doing so. Definitely request him!<br><br>Anyways, i felt my pasta was over cooked as it was a little hard and the chicken was not flavorful at all. <br><br>My guests pasta was ruined because the pepper shaker wasn&#39;t closed properly and as she was applying it, the top fell off and pepper spilled everywhere..<br>But Josh, once again had no problem fixing that. I just wish it weren&#39;t an issue at all.<br><br>All in all, good food, could have been better today.
The food was really good. If you&#39;re going on the weekend, make a reservation to avoid the long line.

The place felt upscale with it&#39;s decorations, however the service and cleanliness of the restaurant was more or less subpar. I wish we had a better dining experience. The very first impression wasn&#39;t even that good - we were greeted and handed a buzzer. However, when it buzzed and I handed it over to the hostess, she took it without saying anything. Then, another hostess came over and seated another group of two under our name (I don&#39;t even know how that could happen). The first hostess attended to me again and basically forgot why I was standing in front of her. Overall, that was a small issue but an irritating first impression - we eventually got seated.<br><br>Our table was sticky and it seemed like it didn&#39;t even get wiped down. The hostess that placed us at the table for some reason thought that my fiance and I wanted to sit side by side with one another even though everyone else around us was being sat across from each other. That was another odd situation. My fiance&#39;s silverware and plate got thrown together on the opposite side of me as the hostess fumbles to move everything back to where it originally was.<br><br>We ordered our food and it ended up well. The food was pretty good and the presentation was neat. My fiance ordered a California Cheesesteak and he liked it; however it did seem a bit small given how much he got it for, about ~$15. My Louisiana Chicken Pasta was great though. Thanks to the kitchen for serving us that night!<br><br>Aside from the odd mishaps in the beginning of the night, we still had a good time at the Cheesecake Factory in Atlanta. I don&#39;t think I will be coming back though given the weird first impression and the cleanliness of our seats and table.
When I go to the cheesecake factory, the restaurant is always nice but there is always a 30 min or more wait time. The food is always mediocre.

So I&#39;ve been avoiding making a review on this location - I&#39;ve been trying to take into consideration that covid is taking a toll on many business but this location seems to be way below every other business in this area- and it feels like they aren&#39;t even trying. <br><br>Let me start with - I am a fan of the cheese cake factory . So far since covid I have orders from this location 6xs. I was disappointed 5 out of those 6 times . <br><br>1) the portions ( especially take out )are way less than normal <br>2) The taste is bland ! Nothing seems to have a taste anymore - or Atleast not a good one <br>3) The staff that handles take out is mostly unprofessional and simply uninterested in doing their job . For the third time I&#39;ve ordered take out and went to the patio set up to pick up my order . I got an txt saying my food was ready ten minutes before I arrived. When I asked for my order without checking the young lady told me staff from inside would bring it out . Ten minutes pass  and the young lady from inside came out with several orders and asked my name - I gave  her my name and she looked puzzled- she had bought my order out twenty minutes ago and was confused why the staff outside didn&#39;t give it to me- the staff outside didn&#39;t even check for my name ! <br>4) I ask for tableware and never receive it in my<br>take out- not once !<br>Look all of restaurants are struggling but I&#39;ll keep supporting those that are still putting in effort . I can&#39;t say I believe this location is .

I stopped by the Cheese Cake Factory late at night as I was coming back from a customer meeting in Atlanta. I was staying right by the Cumberland Mall and the Cheesecake Factory is one of the only decent restaurants opened later during the week!<br><br>I hadn&#39;t eaten most of the day so needed to fill up  on bread, an app, and a large Italian dish, my pasta.  I want to focus on the first two:<br><br>The bread is fantastic! It arrives warm and in all different shades if color and goodness. I buttered it up to perfection.<br><br>Now, the salad was small and the waitress let me know it was only a light portion;; however, it blew my mind. I subbed the dressing out for a vinaigrette and it pulled the greens, beet, and fruit together. I was a happy customer. By the end with the  pasta overflowing in hunger relief I left in high spirits.<br><br>Thanks Cheesecake Factory of Atlanta!
Horrible customer service and the managers don&#39;t give a shit. Save your money or go somewhere else where they value you as a customer.

Service here is absolutely horrible. We got there at 11:20,  there was nobody there to serve us yet, and they made us wait for 10 minutes before getting our seat. <br><br>Food: An hour later, we got our food. I ordered the turkey burger, and it was pink in the middle. You have to be kidding me. What kind of restaurant doesn&#39;t test the temperature of things, especially poultry? <br><br>Hoping I don&#39;t get sick.

I love this location! Always great vibes the energy is amazing and the food is delicious every time! I love the Louisiana Pasta dish, the crispy chicken has this breading that&#39;s out of this world! I would recommend grabbing the Mango drink and maybe another one togo haha you won&#39;t regret it! Awesome atmosphere, I&#39;m coming here all the time.

So my mommy and daughter day at this place with everything going on don&#39;t trust it.  The first booth was I fasted with nets, we were them moved to a dirty both.  We ended up taking the food to go and will not be coming back anytime soon.  The worst part is the white manager acted as if it was nothing was wrong smmfh...I asked my daughter if she wanted to stay she even said no and she&#39;s 11.  The pic is just one pic I took before paying and leaving, won&#39;t be going back I&#39;ll go to Lenox first before ever coming
One of my favorite locations to go during the week for dinner or lunch. I like the environment during the week. Not too many people and fast service.

There was glass in my food! So disgusted. Imagine eating and then you find something hard in your mouth and figure out its freaking glass . The manager Preston H insisted that it was plastic instead of glass and that they don&#39;t even have that kind of plastic on their line. As if it&#39;s better to have plastic than glass cooked in your dinner.

come to this location all the time since it&#39;s the closest to me... not a fan of the parking... always good customer service...great drinks and food... make sure to always get the brown bread and ask to warn up the butter

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory many many times at numerous locations across the country. The food is good and the portions are huge, but this location has particularly terrible service every single time we go. After this experience, we will not be returning.<br><br>We went over at about 8pm on Friday night and there was a 10-15 minute wait for 2 people. No big deal. It&#39;s Friday night. We get seated at a banquette table and it&#39;s very loud around us but still fine.<br><br>We were out for an actual occasion, so we looked over the drink menu, picked drinks, discussed appetizers, changed our minds several times on which one to get, debated on which entree&#39;s to get for several minutes, reconsidered which drinks to get with our food, and decided what to get. This took approximately 10 minutes. We closed our menus and waited for our server, who had been in the area several times at other tables giving out checks and filling drinks--ok, cool, no problem. He&#39;s busy.<br><br>So he leans over after handing the table next to us their check and says &#34;I&#39;ll be right with you.&#34; We smile and say no problem. He closes out their check and refills drinks for another table... in the meantime, a party of 4 has been seated one table down from us.<br><br>Instead of coming back to take our order, he goes to this table, takes their drink order AND THEN GOES TO THE COMPUTER TO PUT IT IN WITHOUT STOPPING BY OUR TABLE. We had been sitting there for almost 20 minutes at this point. As soon as he went to the computer without stopping at our table too, my husband asked if I wanted to go someplace else. I agreed and we got up. Then, it got worse.<br><br>As I was trying to walk past without issue, our would-be server STANDS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE AISLE WITH HIS ARMS OUT BLOCKING ME FROM LEAVING. *WHAT?!* He says, &#34;aww are you leaving me?&#34; I said, &#34;yes. We waited for a very long time.&#34; To which he responded, &#34;yeah sorry bout that.&#34; And he moved out of the way.<br><br>I did not want to stay to mention it to a manager because after being blocked from leaving I was a little shaken and just wanted to go.<br><br>We went next door to Ted&#39;s. Their hostess was friendly, our server was delightful, the atmosphere was quiet and peaceful, and the food at Ted&#39;s was delicious and hot. <br><br>Next time we will skip Cheesecake Factory. Terrible experience.

Today was not the best experience today at the Cheesecake Factory At Cumberland.  The wait was about 15 minutes, which was not bad at all. The hostess were very nice and our food was good but the service was NOT the best.  So, here we go: We were seated in a booth in the middle of the restaurant. Very busy area.  We was greeted by a woman name Darlene, which we found out her name later on. She came to the table and immediately gave a nice/nasty attitude unsure why.  <br><br>She told she would be with us shortly she needed to put in some orders.‍ About 5 mins later she returned and took our drink orders.  I ordered an Arnold Palmer and my honey had just water. <br><br>The Arnold Palmer had to come from the bar, so when she bought his water back she says, the bar is backed up and you will have to wait for your drink because it comes from the bar, and that was before I could comment or say anything.  <br><br>I ignored her and we asked for about 2 more mins to look over the menu.  I asked were there any specials or features and she made it very clear to me that they do not offer specials LOL.  Just craziness.  <br><br>She leaves and comes back about 4 mins later and takes our order.  I ordered the Evelyn&#39;s pasta with a side of Alfredo sauce.  A server came to bring our food and it was great.  He order a BBQ Bacon Burger I believe.  I was so frustrated with the service and was exciting to taste the great food.<br><br>She offered us dessert and we said no and asked for the check.  When the check came she brought that back quickly.  I was done with the restaurant, not sure when I will return.  Thanks Cheesecake Factory. Pictures to follow

This is my favorite restaurant! But the quality of service has gone down tremendously! With the new items on the menu the chicken was rubbery, the fruit was sour after sending it back twice and the fries were cold on the kids meal. We&#39;ve been coming to Cheesecake Factory for over 10 years and we were so disappointed today by our quality of service. I&#39;ll admit this past year, I don&#39;t know if there has been a change in chefs but the quality of food my last 3 visits have not been the usual Cheesecake Factory standards

Slowest service. While I realize we went on a Friday evening, we expected to not have a 2 hr dinner experience after waiting 30 minutes for a table. After being seating, it took forever for our server to come greet us. After receiving our drinks we had to wait again forever before he came back to take our order. Food took forever to be delivered and luckily it was correct because he never came back to check on us. Food was ok but I think we would have eaten anything at that point. Got cheesecake to go and when he delivered it, it fell off the table bc no dishes had been cleared and he could have cared less. Overall a really disappointing experience. Though the cheesecake was excellent as always ... even if it was smooshed. No pictures of our meal because we devoured it after waiting so long.

The Cheesecake Factory has always been a favorite of mine. It&#39;s Always an occasion that I get to go given the closest one is 2 hours from me. Tonight was a horrible experience, our food took over an hour and a half to get(after the appetizer was delivered). My girlfriend got the Bang Bang chicken and shrimp, and it tasted like cold baby food. My Chicken romana was cold and flavorless with little to no sauce. Out of respect for my waiter, we asked to exchange the Shrimp dish for another Chicken Romana. We paid full price for the meals (out of me feeling like I already caused enough trouble and I still took care of my waiter because it wasn&#39;t his fault the food was horrendous) and it really sucked given that I hype this place up so much and traveled so far on a date to eat there. Out of the 6 times I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory for very special occasions, this experience has me questioning if I will ever go back.

There was an issue with my order but they were so kind and accepted the fact that they had made a mistake. The manager took responsibility right away and took care of the issue so it was still a great experience. They worked as a team to make sure that they did not drop the ball. I know that everything will not always be perfect but it&#39;s how they handle the situation that made all the difference. I will definitely go back. The food was great!

I&#39;ve been to several Cheesecake Factory restaurants across the country, and this store had the nicest server but the worst food. I was really disappointed because I&#39;ve never had a bad meal at this chain and was so excited to finally get my husband inside one. I had the chicken marsala; the noodles were severely undercooked and the chicken was lile rubber. My husband couldn&#39;t even eat his burger; he said the sauce on it was disgusting, and he is NOT a picky eater. He got the bacon bacon burger. And, his bacon was burned :(

I&#39;m all about good customer service these days and this restaurant has none. I called to place a to go order only to be told that they don&#39;t take to go orders over the phone and I would have to place the order online or at the restaurant. I explained that I tried to order online but it would not go through with my gift card. The lady then placed me on hold for ten minutes and never came back. I was only coming here because of my gift card but honestly it&#39;s not worth it. They clearly don&#39;t care about my business. During a COVID19 pandemic you&#39;re telling people to order in the restaurant only to have to stand inside for 30 minutes with numerous, mask-less people passing by! Smh! Poor service with mediocre food doesn&#39;t deserve my money. Location at Perimeter mall is much better if you just have to have Cheesecake Factory.

I am reminded of why I have not dined at a Cheesecake Factory in a while. I am also sure this has been one of my worst dining experiences. <br><br>We visited for a going away dinner. Our table was a large party; however, we were not an overwhelming size, especially with two hosts. It seems there was poor communication and coordination amongst the two. <br><br>Our food took entirely too long to arrive and it was still cold when we received it. The best part about our visit was the cheesecake. I will not be returning.
I only came for cheesecake, gave them a 4 because they no longer have my favorite one. Carrot cake cheesecake. Quite annoyed even though I know it isn&#39;t exactly their fault..
Great experience with my family. Fast friendly service. Making reservations was an easy experience and saved a lot of time waiting. Love the food love the atmosphere.

TERRIBLE. Why reserve space when the restaurant doesn&#39;t have space available.  80% of my party arrived on time and we still had to wait for a table to become available.  I confirmed the reservation not once, but twice, so the Restaurant knew I was still coming. Why not block off that section or those amount of tables for that reserved party? I will never host another birthday dinner at Cheesecake Factory ever again. My party spent lots of money. Talk about supporting a business that had been closed for over 30 days due to COVID19, Cheesecake didn&#39;t appreciate my business.

This location is ALWAYS busy but the overall service is pretty good. This tome around I just ordered cheesecake to go since the wait time was extremely long. We had the caramel pecan turtle cheesecake and it was so good we forgot to take pictures, lol. I would recommend you bring your patience if you decide to dine here.

So I had someone pick up a carryout order for me this evening.  The person made another stop also, so when I saw how big the bags were, I just thought they put a bag from the other store inside one of the Cheesecake Factory bags.  Well, turns out included in my bag and charged me for someone else&#39;s dessert order (2 pieces of cake for $19).<br><br>I called and asked to speak to the manager and he actually said that it was my person&#39;s fault for not looking at the receipt and then asked if I would come back out at almost 9pm on a cold evening to bring the items back.  I did tell him that the desert had not been touched (I called as soon as I noticed that it was in the bag) and that they could send someone to the hotel across the street to pick it up.  The manager was very snippy about their mistake and refunding the card.  He only offered to take care of it after I said that I would call corporate and get my refund from them. This was my third bad experience at this location in the last few months. As much as I love their pumpkin cheesecake, I&#39;ll have to get it elsewhere.  I will not be returning to this restaurant until they train their managers on soft skills and get a better process for checking orders.

I dine at this restaurant frequently, I&#39;ve had a few not pleasant meals. I&#39;ve also experienced several cheesecakes that were not too tasty. I think the business was very clean, management friendly. But not sincere towards my complaints.

I came for the half price cheesecake and it was definitely a mistake. My salad had waaaaay to much cheese(ceasar) and chicken was not done. Sent chicken back and it still came out half done. Ok no thanks. I got a slice of cheesecake and took home half for my daughter. We both was sick all night. This just confirmed.... cook more eat out less!!!

On Monday, June 29, 2020 I decided to have lunch with three other friends at your Cumberland mall location in Atlanta Ga. The host informed us that there was a 20 min wait, we gave the hostess our point of contact and went to go outside to be called for our table. <br><br>It took 40 min to be seated but we did not complain we just wanted to eat. Once we get to the table I noticed crumbs  all over the bench, so I told the host about the crumbs and she took her hand and bushed them on the floor. Immediately after sitting down my arm began to stick to the table. We looked around and there was food all over the table. We asked the server to clean the table and without a response she walked away and a few minutes later a gentleman comes over with out a word and begins spraying the table with some type of spray!! I got sprayed in the face with it and that&#39;s when I said excuse me can you at least let us get up first before you start spraying us down?<br><br>We sat back down only to realize the table was still sticky!!! The server comes over finally and tells my friend Who is carrying a small Pepsi bottle that his bottle could not sit on the table due to Covid precautions.  That&#39;s when my girlfriend says it&#39;s funny that you would say that when this table is filthy and we&#39;ve been trying to get it clean since we&#39;ve been here. I have a real problem with the fact that your employees put me and my whole party at risk by sitting us at a filthy table and we waited not one, not two but three times for them to clean the table before was actually clean. Your manager that was on duty b6 the name of Amy Chouinard is a very poor leader which was  demonstrated by her and the staffs lack of Apology or remorse for putting me and my guest at risk of catching COVID-19. Not once did anyone on the staff give a simple apology instead we were giving excuses for why it&#39;s OK for your restaurant to be lax on the states strict Covid guidelines. I am mortified and angry that your staff acted as though they could care less about the cleanliness  of this establishment.

The customer service is terrible! I&#39;ve eaten at several Cheesecake Factory restaurants around the country and this one by far is the worst. The waiter was horrible! He actually submitted the order wrong and then proceeded to argue with my family member about the incorrect order! The manager wasn&#39;t very helpful either. Horrible experience the whole way around!

Update: I was given a call from the store I ordered from, and had the opportunity to speak with someone about the bad experience. Kudos to you Cheesecake Factory for having great customer service. Service like this keeps your business...and my money. Thank you! (**I added 2 stars**)<br><br>Update, yet again...They followed up to speak with me about the situation, then told me that they would send me a $20 gift card, to come in for a better meal on them.  Two weeks later....no gift card, and ignoring my messages to reach out and claim my supposed gift?  I take back the 2 stars I added.  1 star is what this restaurant location and staff deserves.  Follow through is very important.

Came here for lunch, which is usually peak hours. Our server was great! She was friendly and attentive. That&#39;s the only reason I am rating 3 stars. <br><br>But the food was probably the worst I&#39;ve ever had at a Cheesecake Factory. I ordered the skinnylicious chicken salad sandwich. The bread was over-toasted I could barely bite into it. I ended up just eating the chicken salad. The chicken salad itself was &#34;meh.&#34; I&#39;ve had better at a Zaxbys...which doesn&#39;t cost $12.50 for a bland sandwich.
Good brunch options. Their chicken that comes with chicken and waffles is super crunchy and tasty. The waffles are bit too crispy for me though. Good for a chain restaurant brunch.
Normally the food is really good but my carbonara pasta wasn&#39;t  taste like food... they always have a great seRvice but today the food taste like dish soap

I went here during the week. I wanted to grab dinner as well as kill some time instead of sitting in traffic. <br><br>I sat in the patio area. <br><br>I always get all whole grain bread because it tastes better to me. I ordered the dinner portion grilled salmon, mashed potatoes, and spinach. It never fails me! It was so delicious. This was less than $25. <br><br>This is located outside of Cumberland Mall near H&amp;M. There is mall parking available.

Worse Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been. Had an order to go and continued asking the man working the bakery counter if it was ready or if he could check as there were to go bags sitting on the side ready. I understand he&#39;s busy but don&#39;t tell me yeah I&#39;ll check and help other people that walk up but never check. Food was cold by the time I got it. Won&#39;t be coming back to this location.

I must say that I really enjoy Cheesecake Factory. I almost vowed to never go back as it brings back memories of a time when I had bad morning sickness but I&#39;ve managed to survive.<br><br>Nonetheless, I can&#39;t say I&#39;ve had anything really bad. My favorite are the raspberry lemon cheesecake and the monte cristo.

Service was good but food was very disappointing. I got the steak Diane and chicken madeira. I received the food cold and our waiter had it remade but the taste wasn&#39;t anything special. Steak was dry and chicken was thin not even a full breast and salty. I also don&#39;t think the steaks should be called medallions but more like small steak chunks. It wasn&#39;t worth the $29 that&#39;s for sure. My friends food wasn&#39;t all that good either. The shrimp and chicken gumbo was warm but bland.

Came here for a birthday lunch. There is plenty of parking because it is at the mall but it can get a little crowded. <br><br>We were offered bread bowls upon seating and the waitress too my drink order. The waitress was helpful and nice.<br><br>I got the skinnylicous chop house salad. I asked for Caesar on the side just in case I didn&#39;t like the vinegarette it was tossed in. My salad came out dry and I had to wait for both dressings. My friend order extra Alfredo sauce on the side and they brought her marinara sauce and no Alfredo sauce ever arrived. The food also took forever to come out and we were there during the lunch hour and ordered from the lunch menu.

Came for happy hour on Tuesday before a concert down the street. We got there just before happy hour was supposed to end so we took advantage of that. The dunwoody location has happy hour food and drinks but this location only has happy hour food which was slightly disappointing. I got a drink that ended up being twice the amount I paid for happy hour food lol oops big mistake but it was tasty. I got the passion fruit margarita. It was just the right amount of strong but still really good. The happy hour food we got were the roadside sliders, crab and artichoke dip, chicken potstickers and the fried macaroni and cheese. All were really good choices and the portions for happy hour are great also.

placed my family of 4 on the list and was told by the we would receive a call and it could be 50 minutes to a hour wait. I received a text instead and made out way to the door. As we were entering the door, a hostess who was talking to another customer rudely stated &#34;Excuse me, can y&#39;all wait?&#34;As I attempted to show her my phone she stated &#34;Umm one minute&#34; and continued her conversation. I have attached a screenshot of the text message that gives instructions to go to the front desk. We stood at the door for another 3 minutes or so before she said &#34; Last name?&#34;. I provided our last name and asked if my family was okay to enter. She stated &#34; Yea&#34; and continued with another customer. Once we entered and presented at the front desk. A woman asked for our name , I was later informed that her name was Amy and she was a manager. I provided my last name with an emphasis on &#34;V&#34; not &#34;B&#34;. After several moments , Amy located our last name and proceeded to tell me that she text at 5:22 and it was passed their policy wait time. I showed Amy my phone and informed her that I received the text message at 5:31 and was held at the door as I just explained above. Amy&#39;s response was that their system showed 5:22 pm. My family and I continued to stand at the desk. After several moments of us just standing there, Amy finally gave instructions for the young lady to seat us. Amy never offered an apology, in fact she dismissed me all together. It was disheartening to know that she was a manager and explained the young ladies attitude at the door. The only reason we didn&#39;t leave is because I promised my 5 year old son a cheesecake. After we spent a little over $125, we won&#39;t be returning. I rated my experience at 2 because our waitress Honey mad the experience tolerable and was really kind to my son. I understand that Covid has us all a little out of sorts but customer service should always be priority.

The food was good but the Manager was very rude because I have to take send my food back because of the  Red sauce I am forgot my shrimp. - I couldn&#39;t even eat there no more because he was so rude I was thinking he would do something to my food. Will not be eating there no more. If I can give NO star I WOULD. Bad customer service.

Can a place get any worst costumer service????  What training is made by them?? A party of twelve can&#39;t get any reservations whatsoever and a estimated wait of about 4-51/2 hours.  Who does this??? <br>Food can be great but they really need to be realistic! Not only I&#39;m disappointed by this but when I called to find out the wait time they said it&#39;s very quickly accommodated a port of 12!!!! So please can anyone help me understand this math. You arrive and wait for 4-51/2 hours.  A party of 12 what time will this people be served? After 1 am.  When the place closes at 12:30 am !!! Ridiculous!!!! Ridiculous

Extremely disappointed in the service and meal at the Cheesecake Factory. Had to ask for silverware twice received one set for the two of us! Received our meals and they were cold. I then ask for Parmesan cheese to add some flavor to the pasta it never came! We sat at the bar and yes it was busy but that&#39;s no excuse for low quality food or service

The Cheesecake factory always has the best brunch! We went early. There was no wait. The food was awesome... We had the Chicken and waffles, pancakes, bacon and chicken Samosas. Everything was Delicious!

I&#39;ve been a loyal customer in Dallas and Tulsa and after moving to Atlanta, I had high hopes it would be the same excellent service I&#39;ve always had. Not only did they miss the mark for Cheesecake Factory service, but honestly this was the worst dining experience we&#39;ve had since we moved to Atlanta. The bartenders seemed inebriated and checked on us twice in the almost 3 hours we were sitting there. Our appetizer took an hour to get to us and our entrees  came another hour later, along with the two girls who sat down 10 minutes before their food came. Our food was so cold, I took one bite of my burger and boxed it. I don&#39;t enjoy being one to leave negative comments on establishments, but I would look elsewhere if you&#39;re wanting good service and at least warm food on your date night.

I went to cheesecake factory in Cumberland mall to celebrate my wife birthday just recently. This is our 1st attempt dine-in since the pandemic hit. I had good and bad experience. I like that now they accept reservation. Social distancing experience also excellent. Table was placed far enough from each other. We ordered calamari as appetizer and the food arrived bland and cold. It took over an hour waiting for the main entrees to arrive. We got steak diane/chicken Madeira combo &amp; chicken riesling and both are excellent although I felt a bit less portion than normal. The worse thing is we all had some degree of stomache pain/diarrhea  after went home. I was questioning about the food hygiene as we notice flies flying around our table.

Unfortunately, every part of our meal was messed up. The Mac n cheese bites were cold when they came out. The manager came over and simply said, &#34;oh you didn&#39;t like them?&#34; rather than maybe greeting us or a simple, what was wrong with them? It&#39;s not that we didn&#39;t like them, it&#39;s that they were completely still cold inside of them. My guests pasta meal came out with uncooked noodles. Not Al Dente, more undercooked than that. My salmon salad had barely any toppings on it too. The Korean fried cauliflower bites were the only alright thing. Normally it&#39;s not this horrible dining here, definitely not coming back anytime soon. The server was great, they did everything correctly and provided great service.
The quality of food has really gone down and the service wasn&#39;t good at all. Definitely will just coming for the cheesecake only

This place  can&#39;t get it together!! I have ordered doordash from here a few times and every. Single. Time. They have messed it up. Guys.... How can you mess up when I just order ONE piece of cheesecake!? They get overwhelmed when door dash throws out that free delivery. I just placed another order via doordash.and... . just received a basil tomato pasta....I paid to add salmon....I received chicken....... I paid for salmon!  This location needs to re train their kitchen staff and front of house.

It&#39;s a place you knowing what your looking for , the dessert is going to be good ,the atmosphere is going to be great too. I went the other day to have dinner haven&#39;t been in a while so I was able to enjoy it . I ate the jambalaya pasta and also a piece of salmon to just be greedy and the salmon was dry but the pasta was great . My waiter was a Male but he wasn&#39;t that great  but kind of made up for it at the end with the free dessert lol I can honestly say it will be a consistent if they had better waiters and waitress that&#39;s all I&#39;m saying.  But they have to long waiting periods and never have great parking at this location.  You have to deal with the mall traffic and surrounding restaurants..

This is not my family first time going to Cheesecake Factory, with that being said sometimes we have good experience and sometime we have bad experience, this time everything went fine now the food is always good . My bad experience I will say come from the server or wait time. The parking lot is always full it doesn&#39;t matter what time and day you go it&#39;s always full. And that is because they share a parking lot with the mall and a few more restaurant, I did not give it five star because like I said some times it&#39;s not the best but the food is good so I gave it four stars for the food.

June 22 2019 4:15 pm Started off with typical hour wait . Food appetizers wait ! While eating bread a lovely huge cockroach came walking right across the floor ! Disgusting! My daughters 17th birthday! We drove from Dallas ga ! My husband pointed it out to a server and he squashed it and drug it across the floor with his foot spreading guts and wings ! I was disgusted ! We had already ordered but my appetite was GONE ! I emailed that night and a manager called me today June 24 th ! Apologized and said it&#39;s summer so bugs come in !  $106 we spent on food !! Will not return!!!

I&#39;m not a huge fan of cheesecake factory but my boyfriend really wanted to go. The one thing I will say is nice-they have something for whatever you are in the mood for. <br><br>I ordered the soup of the day, which was french onion soup. It was very good and filling. It came with parmesan cheese and fresh croutons on top. (cost $5.95)<br><br>For my entree, I ordered the shrimp and chicken gumbo. I loved the fresh ingredients and veggies but the chicken was super dry. (cost $17.95)<br><br>My boyfriend ordered the grilled salmon meal with mashed potatoes and aspargus. The salmon was char-grilled and the tasted overpowered the underseasoned meat of the fish. The asparagus and mash potatoes were so yummy! (cost $17.45) <br><br>We got dessert to go. I got the triple white chocolate raspberry cheesecake and he ordered the tiramisu flavored cheesecake. They looked and taste amazing! <br><br>Parking: mall parking so free and available with an option to valet for $20.
Excellent service on June 18th by Caleb!  Fantastic server with great knowledge of the menu. Service was quick and food was good. 5 stars to the entire team!

The wait here is horrible! They really need to consider hiring more staff to accommodate the crowds. Arrived at 5:30 to be told there is a 3-5 hour wait....why!!! There is not a crowd inside. Kept checking and finally told them to separate our party of ten into 2 tables of 5, we are starving!!! At this point we just want to sit down and eat. Now waiting 20 minutes for the first table of 5 l, then 25 minutes for the next table of 5 to be seated.  This food better be good!!!!!

This was my first time at the restaurant... I&#39;ve had the cheesecake several times. Food was delicious. I had the Jamaican dish with chicken and shrimp with Raspberry Lemon Cheesecake. My niece had the  Lemon Herb Chicken with the Oreo Dream Cheesecake. The desserts...well options are endless. We went on Friday so they were very busy so expect to wait at least 30 mins or more to be seated. Definitely would go back.

Captains log: UPDATE<br><br>I got a call the other night from I am assuming one of the GM&#39;s of the location, and she apologized for everything that went on. We went back and forth about the interaction of the day. And she explains she is unsure as to why things happened the way they did but they aren&#39;t standard practices. She also stated the smart thing to do would have been to comp the food since I can&#39;t eat cheesecake and explained she doesn&#39;t understand why the manager that night wouldn&#39;t do it. So we ended the call with she&#39;s going to send me out a gift card which doesn&#39;t cover everything that night but hey at this point it&#39;s the thought that counts. And if I&#39;m willing she&#39;d like me to try them out again. The very nice lady on the phone, but I&#39;m not sure if I&#39;ll go back to this location again.

This cheese cake factory is located in Cumberland mall. There are a lot of parkings around, however, it seems like they are always full. It always takes longer than usual to find a parking spot. <br>Suggestion: if you dine with your friends, let them hop in to get a table when you are circling around.<br>We went there on a Sunday night, the waiting was ridiculous long, the estimate time was 40 minutes with no buzzer or other ways to notify me. We waited for over 1 hour 20 minutes to get our seats. Because how busy they were, everything took longer than normal. The dinner took us over 3 hours from waiting for the table to get out of door. The service and food is what you expect from Cheesecake Factory, nothing bad, nothing special.<br>So if you are planning for the quick bite or dinner, stay away from this location.<br>We took off two stars for the poor management and bad manner of the receptionist.<br>Updates: We went back on a Monday and hoping to grab a bite there. The estimated waiting was over 40 minutes. When we were trying to make a decision over the waiting time, the receptionist was giving us really bad attitude, rolling her eyes and others in many disrespectful ways. So we would prefer driving to other locations now than dinning here.

So, I hate cheesecake factory, I&#39;ve never had a good experience at any one that I&#39;ve been to. This one was no exception. Service was bad, food was bad and when you come to a place for a lunch meeting you are usually on a time crunch.  Slow service and mediocre food doesn&#39;t usually get you repeat customers.

We were all visiting Atlanta, and had reached a consensus that we would all enjoy cheesecake factory being that all of our diets are different; vegetarian, pescatarian, gluten-free and some hefty lean meat connoisseurs. Upon sitting down in the bar area we waited for a waitress for over 20 minutes to even speak to us when she did speak to us we were already ready with our orders from drinks to dessert.  We waited another 25 minutes for our food to come mine came first,  then my husband and my brother-in-law and we waited. We waited for another 10 minutes when a manager came out and told us that the pasta that was supposed to be used wasn&#39;t used for the gluten-free option, that it needed to be made again he apologized said it wouldn&#39;t be long.......and we waited, waited another 15 minutes for another manager to come and tell us that the attempt to remake was futile, and that they would have to make it once again now we&#39;re laughing at this point because there&#39;s nothing we can do about our missed reservations to our next Atlanta excursion we were held hostage by the cheesecake factory and the cook in the kitchen for some reason cannot get gluten-free pasta to boil properly or at all for that matter. Seems easy enough really.... we waited 10 minutes went by for yet another manager and our waitress to form us that the order has been incorrect again......I could really go on needless to say we won&#39;t be back

I go to this Cheesecake Factory location whenever I&#39;m in Atlanta. I like it much better than the one by Perimeter. I have the same complaint here that I have for any Cheesecake Factory: too many items on the menu suggests to me most of it is mediocre with a few things that are excellent. <br><br>The avocado egg rolls are always good. I also tried the Korean cauliflower, which was pretty good. It coulda used more sauce, but that texture and flavor were good overall. <br><br>The cucumber lemonade was a really nice surprise! Very refreshing and had a bit of spritz. I&#39;ll be trying that again!<br><br>The honey truffle chicken was just okay. The chicken was cooked well and the texture was perfect, but it was a bit bland. The mashed potatoes were delicious, as always. The asparagus wasn&#39;t good, which was surprising. It&#39;s hard to mess up asparagus. Salt, pepper, olive oil, that&#39;s it. But they were undercooked and hard to bite into. That&#39;s why I prefer the baby asparagus.<br><br>But it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ll be back :)

You can&#39;t go wrong with The Cheesecake Factory. Long waits and no where to stand and wait is the only problem. Maybe I&#39;m just getting older but I don&#39;t like to wait. I just rather come here on a week day and enjoy some good food. I got the Orange Chicken and it was so delicious. The hubs got the Parmesan Chicken &#39;pizza style&#39; and for dessert we got Tiramisu (no cheesecake ).

The end of our vacation was ruined by the vomiting, diarrhea and  fevers that engulfed our entire little family after eating here. <br><br>We grabbed food to go, which we ordered online and they also didn&#39;t get the order correct although it was ready within 40 minutes which is downright fast for the Cheesecake Factory. If you dine in expect serious waits as there was a line out the door.<br><br>We love the Mac and cheese balls at Cheesecake Factory and they did taste good as did all of our dishes but it was spoiled by the sickness that ensued. <br><br>Like the rest of this mall, flashy but disappointing. We were too sick to go back and complain.

You ask for cheese cake with a la mode and the cake doesn&#39;t come with ice cream. You wait another ten minutes for the server to come around and tell her you asked for a la mode and her response is, &#34;yeah it&#39;ll come in a minute.&#34; It&#39;s suppose to come together. You ask for bread and when you ask again her response is, &#34;its in the oven right now&#34; although later she brings the check and says the oven went under maintenance and she can&#39;t bring the bread.  Save your money.

I ordered food to be delivered and I got rice that wasn&#39;t even cooked and orange chicken with no sauce on it.... So I paid $20 for some dry chicken pretty much. I&#39;m not ordering from here again for delivery......

We went to the cheesecake factory with high expectations. Unfortunately we were quickly disappointed after our appetizers which were quite good. By our main course which was very bland lacking flavor. Not to mention everyone who eat with us had stomach issues afterwards which definitely did not lead for a good impressions. I will not be coming back to the cheesecake factory.

We had a great experience !  Food was super !  We both ordered the cheeseburger and it was HUGE and tasted like it just came off of an outdoor grill ! Our waitress was very sweet ! Great date to celebrate our 19th wedding anniversary I only gave 4 stars for one reason ... they are very slow so if you don&#39;t have time to wait , choose another place to eat !

This restaurant is located in a mall with plenty of parking and valet parking. The restaurant itself is beautiful, and the wait staff were nice but the price and quality of the food is okay. I ordered the Chicken carbonara and the pasta was dry and the sauce seemed microwaved and burnt, the chicken was over cooked and chewy, not many peas and overall I would not go back and order it again but my husbands meal( chicken, mushrooms, mashed potatoes and asparagus ) was amazing!!!! If you go there order his meal and not mine for sure and make sure to get cheesecake because it&#39;s amazing and worth he price for the amount you get.
Ordered a cheddar stuffed burger and they forgot the cheese  but other than that the service was great. Came a little later and got seated right away. Always look forward to cheesecake to go!

Ordered over $180 of food for my daughter&#39;s birthday yesterday which made for an expensive disappointment. The calamari were initially good, until we all started to run into pieces with odd textures and a nauseating overly fishy taste. The hot spinach and cheese dip is usually great, but this time it was almost soupy, and tasted only like the creamy base with spinach (like bland creamed spinach)... I&#39;m pretty sure they weren&#39;t done making it, they forgot the seasoning and the cheese. The bang bang chicken and shrimp (we had 2 of these unfortunately), was inedible. I love ginger, but there&#39;s a limit (I didn&#39;t even realize that this dish had ginger, but apparently that&#39;s the primary ingredient). The ginger was so overpowering, that&#39;s ALL you could taste. The cheesecake was at least good, the hamburger was decent, and I think the best thing was avocado eggrolls. All in all, still very disappointing.

Came on a day it snowed, so service was excellent and food was hot and fresh since it was practically empty. Ordered lunch portions of chicken riesling pasta and shrimp &amp; sausage pasta. Portions were generous, especially the chicken reisling pasta. I think they may have mistakenly given me the dinner portion. Too many menu options, so it&#39;s difficult to choose what you want.
Packed as always on a weekend so I just ordered cheesecake. But I still had to wait quite a while to get it,  but it was worth it in the long run as they have the best cheesecake in the industry.

Good food but terrible service. I was seated during a slow time and waited 17 minutes until I had to stop a waitress to just see who was taking my table. So after an additional 10 min of waiting, I walked out. <br><br>Never coming back to this location.

Today they failed in most of the important areas...<br>Customer service from management, food quality and of food preparation.  There was hair in my colleagues Shrimp Scampi, they were out of a simple menu option buffalo wings.  Usually this spot meets expectations but has seemed to go down in quality and seems no one really cared

Got my team lunch from here and everyone was quite impressed!  Part of my 5-star rating goes to the fact that our order for 15 was correct!  Their curbside service is awesome as well.  Didn&#39;t have to fight the heat and try to carry 6 bags by myself!  My team enjoyed their meals.  I&#39;d patronize again.

This location had the worst service. Our waiter was slow and inattentive. I ordered the Louisiana Pasta and it was dry and gross. The chicken wasn&#39;t even hot. I could&#39;ve stayed at home and ate Campbell&#39;s Chicken Noodle Soup.

First off,  Food was horrible!!!!! Only thing that was decent was the jambalaya pasta... ordered an appetizer of Super Nachos , upon arrival I noticed that the kitchen took a beef hamburger patty and crumbled it up and burnt so it could appear as ground beef.  Ask waitress Dee Dee if they had salsa for nachos ( they were dry as hell) , cheese wasn&#39;t melted, guacamole was brown.  All I mentioned to DeeDee was, they was nasty and dry. After waitress DeeDee me brushed off. (Didn&#39;t show any eye contact, No apology or any acknowledgement of my concerns at all.<br>Seconds, later here comes the manager. Asking me what was wrong. I went through everything that was wrong with the Nacho. After that the B*** Dee Dee didn&#39;t want anything to do with us. ( never was rude to her period) she didn&#39;t make the food... but she acted as if we wasn&#39;t her table anymore after that. Never offered me a refill. Nothing!!! Then when my meatloaf came out . It was burnt as hell. I tell the waitress to tell the manager to take the meatloaf off my ticket as I returned the meal. As I told DeeDee my issue she didn&#39;t look at me at all. Don&#39;t understand that part. Then here comes the manager. Agreed it was burnt ! Bitch just took the meatloaf off my ticket. No one did anything to compensate us , as far as customer service goes. <br>Never going h

This evening my sister , I and our friends went to Cheesecake Factory to have a birthday dinner and unfortunately it was not up to our standards. Our waitress took 20 minutes just to get our drink order. She continued to disappear for lengths of time and our food was not hot when we received. Definitely will not be going back here soon

Came in as a party and they sat us in separate groups and messed our checks all the way up. Took literally an hour or so to get our checks together. Horrible management, I&#39;m highly disappointed. Come here at your own risk. Service sucked and they had the audacity to add gratuity. This establishment sucks. Period.

Three of my co-workers and I had lunch here today. The food was pretty good but service was terrible. The server took more than 15 minutes bring drink order and it was not correct. We waited over 50 minutes on our food order to arrive after ordering. It was simple order of hamburgers and salad. I suggest you have plenty of time if you want to eat here.<br>We were there for lunch and like most working people, we have a limited time away from our job. I&#39;m curious if the Cheesecake Factory gives their employees two hours for lunch?

Probably the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at a Cheesecake Factory. Hour and some change wait, no problem since we had a large party. Then it took about an half hour to get our drinks (all non-alcoholic). They ended up splitting our party into two tables with two different servers. Slow is the an understatement for the service. Table 2 of 2 finished eating and had paid for their food by the time our food came out. The service was Extremely slow and almost every order was incorrect in some way. I personally ordered the veggie burger and was Very disappointed in the taste and on top of that it completely fell apart. After reading reviews and hearing so many good things about the veggie burger I was not impressed. This will be my last trip to this particular location. I will say the manager was very accommodating and attempted to fix all of the problems.

The experience here was short and sweet. Long story short visit the bar. Met the bar tender Drew! Amazing conversation and service. He suggested the meal. The meal was pressured to my satisfaction. He suggested a wine, the wine was perfect. We chatted as the bar area got crowded. And then I became dust in the wind! It was precise and worth doing again. I plan on coming here as often as my palate desires!<br>Nate C

Hate to be the one to say it, but not really. I HATE THIS PLACE!! Food is over rated for what you get. I&#39;m a big pasta lover and each time I&#39;ve had the &#34;CAJUN JAMBALAYA PASTA&#34;, it&#39;s always bland. No real taste. This is the spot for the family, but can&#39;t really enjoy it because they know I hate it.  Just imagine the look on someone&#39;s face when you take them to eat and one just sits there like why this place? That&#39;s me in The Cheesecake Factory <br><br> <br><br>To add a positive to the equation the calamari is good but for some odd reason they overwhelmingly give more veggies that the damn calamari which is ridiculous to be an appetizer titled &#34;fried calamari&#34;. What it should say is fried veggies with 4 nicely cooked pieces of squid

I used to go to the Cheesecake Factory at least 2-3 times a month growing up. It was the &#34;cool&#34; place to dine at when in high school. With plenty of menu options and delicious cheesecake, you just can&#39;t go wrong.  Plus the bonus was that you usually can find a Cheesecake Factory next to your neighborhood mall so it was quite convenient.  Not much has changed since then because this location and its sister locations are all within the major malls as well. <br><br> I&#39;ve somehow managed to avoid dining at this chain for most of my 20s but have recently started going back for casual lunches and dinners. Mainly, because of the delicious cheesecake we pick up for dessert.  This location is in Cumberland Mall.  You can&#39;t miss them because they are located near Ted&#39;s Montana Grill.  Service is excellent the handful of times we have visited so far and of course the cheesecake is always delicious. During our last lunch visit however, they served me a slightly frozen slice of my favorite &#34;Wild blueberry White Chocolate.&#34; It wasn&#39;t a huge deal for me because it was still delicious but I can see how others might be peeved by it.  My boyfriend ordered the &#34;Dutch Apple Caramel Streusel&#34; and he enjoyed very bite.  If you love apple pie, you&#39;re going to love this cheesecake.  <br><br>During our last visit, we were both craving burgers so he ordered the Mac n Cheese burger and I ordered the Factory Burger.  The Mac N Cheese is exactly what you think it would be. Picture a juicy burger with includes a mac n cheese patty.  He loved it and was very pleased with his menu choice. I also enjoyed my burger. I was drawn to the wheat bun and the fact that it came with caramelized onions. It&#39;s the same wheat bread that you are typically served while you wait for your entrees.  The meat was cooked well and we both left satisfied.<br><br>NOTE: Our server gave us a heads up that at this particular location, they tend to under cook their meat so if you generally order &#34;medium&#34; then your best bet is to order &#34;medium well&#34; and so on.  <br><br>I&#39;m sure we&#39;ll return soon enough for more cheesecake slices and explore other menu items.

I was craving my favorite Bistro shrimp so we went here for dinner yesterday. The wait for a party of 5 was an hour so we were lucky to find 5 seats at the bar and avoided the long wait. The bartender that was helping us was a woman and she was rude to us. It was obvious she didn&#39;t like Hispanics she whispered something to a gentleman bartender and he started taking our orders. The food was delicious the atmosphere was great but she was rude and unprofessional. It was obvious she hates her job and didn&#39;t want to be there.

As you know this is a chain restaurant, but it is still one of my favorites!  With a multi-page menu there is sure to be something for everyone in your group, no matter what the size.  Everything I&#39;ve tried, from appetizers to dessert, has been just delicious. Even the food on the children&#39;s menu was very good. :)  <br><br>No matter what you order, I recommend saving room for cheesecake.  With over 30 choices there is definitely something here for everyone&#39;s taste!

Service was horrible. Food tasted like water. Even the simple grilled cheese  the cheese wasn&#39;t even melted just a tiny bit . Never will go here again. Cheese cake was good though  only thing that didnt taste crappy

Lackluster!!!  Unfriendly staff behind the bakery counter, small expensive ($7.95) cheesecake slices.  DONT RIP THE CUSTOMERS OFF.....If you are going to charge almost $8 for a slice of cheesecake they should be cut bigger.  The next time that I want cheesecake I will go to the best and order one from Juniors in NYC and let them ship it to Georgia.<br><br><a href="/redir?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.juniorscheesecake.com%2F&amp;s=0fa4f4f6973bfbbcc60268353d441cbad55c566603f1a26b72769b54eb1f3cc0" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">juniorscheesecake.com</a><br><br>Let me say this, Juniors Restaurant has been standing in Brooklyn since the 1800&#39;s, Carnegie deli and Katz deli standing in Manhattan for a long time too.  Nobody beats any of these spots for authentic NYC style cheesecake....melt in your mouth delicious!  And even they don&#39;t charge $55 for a whole cheesecake.  And did I forget to mention that the Cheesecake Factory is  pulling the cheesecake out of the freezer and telling you that you have to wait 2 hours for it to thaw out so you can eat it????  Could understand them freezing it if they were shipping it to someone but not when it&#39;s being sold in the restaurant.<br><br>Paid $26.95 for a raspberry truffle, white chocolate Cheesecake factory cheesecake.....opened the box when we got home and cannot figure out what we paid $26.95 for.  While it taste pretty good, it&#39;s  not good enough to justify the price.  At these inflated prices I don&#39;t want a frozen cheesecake.....It should be fresh!

Kids chicken Alfredo  was disgusting. We spent over one hundred dollars here last night. We should have asked for our money back. The only thing that was decent and I mean decent was the drinks. Don&#39;t waste your time or money here!

This Cheesecake Factory is amazing. I usually go to the one in perimeter so this was a nice change of pace. It&#39;s really cool to have nice bartenders and nice staff. We got a quick bite before the concert we were going to but I might be back just for a little something.

I am seriously trying to figure out when service at Cheesecake Factory became so mediocre. Is it too much to think my server would know the soup of the day? Better yet, is it too much to think if he didn&#39;t he would ask? Well, once I asked him to find out, the service went to hell in a hand basket..our food arrived forty-five minutes to an hour later, cold. The server never once asked if everything was okay, or if we needed anything else. Thankfully, I am not afraid to ask for management. I wasn&#39;t ugly, I wasn&#39;t rude but, I also did not tip!! I will not reward bad service. I think I&#39;m done with Cheesecake. I&#39;ll take my chances with another chain.

As much as I love Cheesecake Factory, I have to give this particular experience a 2 because it does not meet the expectations that I know Cheesecake Factory has for its customers.  The quality of service and food was not what I&#39;ve become accustomed to from this franchise.  I make frequent trips to the area and I&#39;m terribly disappointed.  <br><br>I was perfectly ok with the 30 minute wait that was actually 45 minutes. However, once seated, it was 10 minutes before our server visited the table.  It went downhill from there. For a two person party, the orders were simple. My food arrived at least 10 minutes before my boyfriend&#39;s food. It obviously sat for some time because it should&#39;ve been crispy and it was soggy.  His burger did not have the condiments requested and, despite asking twice, they never arrived.  His salad had no salad dressing and, like the condiments, it never arrived. <br><br>From the time we checked in until his food arrived, it was an hour and 38 minutes. We ordered cheesecake and the bill came before the dessert. After paying and waiting another 15 minutes, we requested it to go.  <br><br>If you&#39;re considering this restaurant for a meal, I&#39;d offer two options... there&#39;s other great restaurants in the same area or be prepared for a long night of mediocre service.

Cheesecake Factory is always a good choice for drinks and food because the menu is so extensive. There is literally something on the menu for everybody and it continues to grow every time that I go. I wouldn&#39;t say that the food is great but the portions are a nice size and it is appetizing.

This has to be one of the most popular chain of restaurants in America...on a mid-range tier...not your run of the mill Applebees or Ruby Tuesday&#39;s. Not knocking them but The Cheesecake Factory is the on the next level. I&#39;ve been here and many locations of the chain but never reviewed any of them. So with today&#39;s lunch being sponsored by my company, I thought I would share my indulgence. <br><br>I am tracking my calories so I am so glad they have the Skinnylicious menu. It offers a ton of items that are still tasty but the calories are cut and listed. Compare this to the regular book menu the restaurant offers. I&#39;m pretty sure a dish averages 15,000 calories overall, and that&#39;s being generous. I ordered the Lemon-Garlic Shrimp with angel hair pasta. I never really eat pasta dishes because it is so high in fat and calories but this was a great chance to take advantage. I had about 6 large shrimp in my dish with a red and green sauce. It was good to taste. <br><br>I also had a few tortilla chips dipped in spinach and artichoke. It was kinda of bland to taste but I preferred that to salty. Of course the hot bread was delivered. Our service was pretty solid. Brandy started not to check on as much towards the end but her and other staff members kept our water glasses full. I think I took 2 sips and put my glass down and she was refilling. No complaints from me. <br><br>How could I leave without trying a piece of cheesecake. My boss recommended the Mango Key Lime Coconut in which I had a 1/4 of it. Wow, it was rich. I don&#39;t think coconut is mentioned in the name of the cake so it was a bit of a surprise. The consistency was so thick and rich it seemed like a sherbet or ice cream with graham cracker crust. I want another piece.

This is my third time at this particular location. I&#39;ve never had a problem before however today was a horrible experience. The family who was sat after us had eaten and boxed their food by the time my entree finally came out. I waited over 45 minutes for an appetizer. Another waiter had to come out and reconfirm our order because someone mixed up table numbers. He was at least kind and accommodating. The manager apologized and said it would be right out. It came out almost 10 minutes later. She did take the price off but that was a small<br>Consolation for the subpar service. My waiter was inattentive and unapologetic. He automatically assumed my change was his tip without asking. I was very disappointed with the service today and I doubt I will return to this location.

It saddens me that I even have to write a one star review for one of my favorite restaurants and locations but it must be done. I ordered a few items for a pickup order which I do very frequently. For a quicker transaction I pressed the reorder button on the website (including 2 crusted chicken Romano&#39;s). Once I waited for my food I just so happened to check one of my bags where I was introduced to chicken romano with white sauce. Keep in mind that with my usual order I always receive the red marinara with no issues. It was fine because mistakes happen in the food industry so I immediately notified one of the servers running food to cars. She then brought me a manager. The manager informed me that &#34;what he sees on the ticket and what I was brought was correct&#34; and I was appalled that he even stated that. Furthermore he told me that the usual crusted chicken romano comes with the Alfredo sauce and that I have to request the marinara sauce. He also explained that I would have to wait another 35-45 minutes for my food. This wouldn&#39;t be as bad if he didn&#39;t already speak to me as if i was stupid and if the mistake was on my part...which it wasn&#39;t. Mind you as I stated earlier I am a very frequent customer at this establishment and this has to be the WORST experience ever. Every year I bring a bunch of people to spend early Christmas dinners and birthdays etc. and to be treated like this feels almost like a slap in the face. I know that the kitchen staff is overwhelmed and instead of admitting this he flips the issue on me and acts as if I put myself in the situation. It breaks my heart honestly but I will definitely never come back to this establishment and will take my money elsewhere. The manager was rude and did not make me feel as if i was a valued customer.

After a less than stellar performance by the waitstaff next-door, my family and I arrived at the cheesecake factory. We had a fabulous meal. It was loud and fun as we sat in the bar. Marcus was an excellent waiter. He took great care of us, had great energy and enthusiasm!

Awful experience here. We (party for 4 adults and 2 children) waited 3 HOURS to be sat. Finally sat. Our sever was nice, however our food was awful by the time we got it! Two of the chicken Marsala&#39;s noodles were hard. Not &#34;al dente&#34; but literally not cooked!! Mine and another&#39;s plates were cold! Not warm, cold. As if it had just been sitting there for over an hour!! If you are going to present yourself as a &#34;fine dining restaurant&#34; please give a &#34;fine dining&#34; experience. Not worth the money spent here after multiple rounds of drinks.
Absolutely love this place.  On way to concert and this was bonus.  Stacy too care of us and she was simply wonderful.   As always a long wait but worth it.  Great food great service.

This cheesecake factory is beyond ghetto. I called in my order and after having to call 10 times someone finally answered the phone. I placed my order than I was advised that there were no more shrimp so I changed my order and was told what time to pick it up.<br><br>Once I got there to pick my food up no one acknowledged me at all. I had to wave a lady down to get someone to help me. As I waited for someone to bring my food up I had to hear the employees curse back and forth at each other being extremely disrespectful to all the customers in line.<br><br>Once someone finally did bring my food out everything was missing!! When I realized that, I told the lady that was ringing me up that some things were missing she caught like the worst attitude because she had to go find the rest of my order... Never again.<br><br>Pro: Resturant is in a great location right by the mall.<br><br>Cons: Too many

This is a chain restaurant found mostly in or around malls. The menu is extensive, a little too extensive, and the food is just okay. I would put it in the same class as Chili&#39;s, Applebee&#39;s, etc. Most people that come here know what they are walking into.<br><br>I thought it was decent not great (okay, the crab cake appetizers were great). The service was good, pleasant and efficient. I had a tortilla salad that was huge but not that delicious. <br><br>The portions are huge and you could probably share any entree.

Same good food.... horrible service... rude waitress... equally rude manager. Honestly, they are giving The Cheesecake Factory a horrible name. I&#39;ll try to find another establishment with a great menu... but one that has equally great service and &#34;vibe.&#34;

I was really looking forward to eating here as a special occasion for my daughters birthday. Boy was I disappointed. We were a party of five - everyone&#39;s meal came out except mine. It took about 15 minutes for a manager to notice. She offered free cheesecake and it would be right up. Not true. My whole party was finished eating before it even came out. I complained to waiter and manager said she would take meal off. Then - we waited another 15 mins for waiter to get our cheesecake order. Just super disappointed. Still waiting on cheesecake as I type this!  Food was awesome - service sucked. <br>Update:  Before we left, we did speak to a manager who willingly listened to all of our concerns.
