We were satisfied with the adjustment made to the bill for the late food and service.

This is the perfect spot for go to food at the bar. You already know what to expect from the CCF. On this occasion I had the Philly Cheesesteak and my favorite cocktail(lemon drop martini).!My friend got the BBQ chicken pizza and it was delicious. This location at Cumberland Mall is pretty busy at 10:30 pm. Lots of meet and greets or pop ups coming through. I wanted to Raspberry Lemon Cheesecake but I was too full after my sandwich. The waitress was pretty attentive even on a Sunday late night. So long story short, great atmosphere and great food!!!!
This is my first time here , I stopped after work only to be annoyed and overwhelmed by the manager after receiving bland food

The service here is horrid! Get ready to wait. The staff has horrible attitudes and move like sloths. I was the only one in line for slice of cheesecake to go. I was ignored and then finally helped. The whole process took 15 min and I was the only one there!
We always have great service. Food is yummy and desserts are heaven. <br><br>Their Lemon Drop martinis are SO good!! :)

Seriously????  Called in a take out order. It wasn&#39;t done for more than 30 min from the time they quoted. Then our food sat on a counter for 10 extra minutes waiting for them to bring two cups of milk. Seriously. Not even peak time. We sat in the restaurant as long as it would&#39;ve take to order eat. <br><br>GET YOUR ACT TOGETHER!

Customer service was horrible I was there waiting for 40 minutes for a family dinner party of 12 offered to sit outside once he saw the wait time was taking longer then expected asked to speak to manager she told us that there was people waiting to be seated outside a head of us but for the last 40 minutes we were outside sitting on the patio waiting for our table there were no was no one out there but our party of 12 no other customers or waiters we left and went to Marlow&#39;s Tavern 6 minutes away food was great and customer service was great

Update: I visited The Cheesecake Factory for lunch and the service was horrible. I&#39;d never seen it so disorganized and a server that was so uninterested in serving the diners. He was dry from the moment I arrived and ended the visit by not speaking to me. It was very unprofessional. He would take forever to come to the table and when he did I asked for condiments. He responded by saying &#34;Is that it?&#34; And proceeded to walk away. About 10 minutes later when he returned he didn&#39;t have everything. I was growing impatient. So I asked for a Caesar Salad Togo because I never got the condiments I&#39;d asked for. He said he would bring me a Togo box. Everyone knows you can&#39;t take a salad with dressing on it to go. It withers. I asked the manager as she was visiting the table next to me about the salad. Side note: They were on their second steak that was prepared incorrectly. The next time I saw the server he just dropped my Togo salad and ticket on the table. He didn&#39;t speak. He just walked off with his head turned away from me. For a $20 sandwich and salad, they need to hire more carefully. <br><br>Also, my table (or the neighboring tables) was never cleaned off. My drink was empty. I went through 3 sets of silverware to get a clean fork and knife. <br><br>Previous rating: 4<br>I visited this location multiple times. The good thing about it is that the food is pretty consistent. The bad part is the menu is so big and diverse and can be hard to decide. The large menu probably contributes to the taste of the food. They don&#39;t have a good specialty. So some items can be extremely bland for the price. I have a couple of items I eat every time I visit and those are great. I LOVE THE CLUB and CEASAR SALAD. It&#39;s great. They also had a shrimp club and crab cake sandwich that were delicious. They also have good drinks at the bar. <br><br>The service is good (dine-in and take-out). There can be a long wait and parking can be an issue depending on the day/time. I personally just park in the mall parking deck and walk through the mall to the restaurant. They could step up cleanliness. I&#39;ve sat at tables with crumbs or received bread plates with crumbs. Overall, I would recommend this location, just know what you want before you arrive and stay away from the bland pasta.

Ok what&#39;s going on at the Cheesecake Factory,<br>with regards to the cheesecake? To be a little <br>more specific what&#39;s the deal with these<br>smaller cheesecake slices? I ran in last night<br>after leaving Costco to satisfy my sweet tooth<br>and noticed when I got home the slice was<br>Smaller than usual, and remembered a <br>couple of my coworkers commented on that<br>recently. They were giving you slices that you <br>could share with someone or finish later. What&#39;s <br>up with that??? Listen for $8 a slice you guys<br>better get it right. I may have to start going over<br>to cafe intermezzo.

Not impressed with this location at all. Two people at my table ordered steaks and they were not cooked properly... when it was brought to the servers attention he could care less .... we will not be going back

it was a very busy day but the service here was great. one thing that wasn&#39;t appealing was how long the wait line was. a table for 8 was going to be a 1-2 hour wait! so my group split up and sat 4/4 which wasn&#39;t that great. but overall it seemed to move quickly with all the chaos in the room.

Celebrating Bday at Cumberland, Georgia  Cheesecake Factory restaurant .  When everyone else in our party had almost finished with their dinner there were three of us that still had no food.  <br>We requested a birthday cake and they brought a cup with whipped cream. ???<br>Forks and spoons were not wrapped but just laying on table.

I recently moved in the area and was excited that I lived next to one now. We went on Sunday around 6pm which of course was a little crowded so that was expected. The hostess could&#39;ve been a little more welcoming. She caught a little attitude, but I politely let it go. Once we were seated, the rest of the evening was great. Our server was very observant and made sure we were always taken care of.

All my stars are for service. Thank you Carlos... you were great dealing with 5 ladies who needed a decent amount of attention on a busy evening. Every request was greeted with a smile and attended to in a timely manner. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory is not my favorite choice of restaurant, however you helped us all pick something from the menu we all liked.

Always a great meal here. The staff are amazingly friendly, the cooks have come out from time to time to discuss how we liked our meal prepped. Not sure why the haters, this place is a gem.  This is the first place I eat at when I come to Atlanta and the last place I eat at before I leave

This place is quick! We got out food before we even finished eating our bread. Granted we ordered our food with our drinks but I was still impressed. The food was fantastic!!! Hubby and I ended up splitting our favorite meal so we wouldn&#39;t have leftovers to worry about going bad on the long drive home and we were both pretty full from it. I could have totally eaten so much more because it was so addicting but this worked out well! I would totally come back here!

Service is horrible. Just a bunch staff walking around talking each and getting nothing done. Waited an HOUR for take out only to get another persons order. Waited another 5min for them to give me mine, only for it to be COLD. Then they tried to go back-n-fourth with me saying &#34;they sure me it&#39;s warm&#34; but I&#39;m the one who just opened it up.  Mind you it was 4:30 with 0 ppl and the bar and 3 couples and tables in the entire place..
This spot atmosphere is good and sitting is fast, however the wait for your food is very long. Well worth the time because the food was sooo good. Must try their specialty chicken Madeira.

Food is always served in large portions, so you definitely end up with leftovers. Meals are hit-or-miss depending on what you order. If you stick to basic entrees you&#39;re usually okay. For example, their french toast is great, but their pasta-pizza dish is not good. Of course, they&#39;re known for their cheesecake, and I have always thoroughly enjoyed my dessert.<br>I only give 3 stars because of entrees being 50/50, service being hit-or-miss, and we&#39;ve had dirty silverware or unclean tables when we were seated as a family on more than one occasion.
Was here the other day for happy hour (M-F 4to6) the happy hour menu is 2 pages and the food  is $5.50 to $6.95( no drink specials). The service was super slow but the food was good.

Cheesecake Factory is pretty damn good no matter what. Having said that; it isn&#39;t that the food wasn&#39;t good in a universal sense, it wasn&#39;t up to the CF norm. You can tell that being connected to the mall makes the demand in this CF less elastic than the relative demand of other similar chains given the difference in quality and the reputation of CF

I came here from Arizona. And despite having a Cheesecake Factory 20 miles from my house, I decided instead to travel 2,000 miles to try it for the first time. <br><br>I might have make that shorter trek sooner or later.<br><br>Ordered mini crab cakes, Chicken Riesling, a slice of Cheesecake, soda, and a Gin &amp; Tonic. This entire thing, tip included, came out to about 45 dollars. Normal folks who don&#39;t need all of that will naturally pay less.<br><br>The drink came in a rather large glass, far bigger than most places I&#39;ve been to. I ordered a Hendricks &amp; Tonic, which is a more premium Gin, but I was surprised that given the size of the drink it was only around 9 dollars. I had honestly expected it to be more. <br><br>The crab cakes weren&#39;t bad, but slightly burnt. Without prompting, inquiry, or concern for this though, the chef had another order of crab cakes brought out to me pre-empting any concern. While I didn&#39;t take it, that is... actually a hell of a thing to do. Even when a touch burnt and not completely uniform in size, it was pretty solid. <br><br>The Chicken Riesling is a mix of chicken, bacon, onions, and a creamy sauce with pasta. To me, that hits basically all my happy notes. I don&#39;t know if it does for you. <br><br>Their cheesecake is also pretty solid, and the Sour Cream top works well for it, although I&#39;m not really a huge sour cream fan.<br><br>I would probably have given this four stars, but the fifth star comes from the chef caring enough to actually pre-empt any concern of mine and deliver another appetizer that didn&#39;t meet their own standard. Hopefully this is the level of concern that this location maintains for every order that goes out, because that was pretty above and beyond the call of duty.

Food is great, service is terrible every time. It&#39;s kind of a big &#34;f*&amp;# you&#34; by the restaurant to begin with that you can&#39;t make reservations for such a busy place. If you&#39;re local, you pretty much know you are going to wait. Okay, I accept that. But for such an expensive and in-demand place, MAN the service is bad. Twice of the four times we&#39;ve gone, they made a big mistake on my order. Most recently, they didn&#39;t put the biscuits in my chicken and biscuits. We pointed it out, it took TWENTY MINUTES for them to bring them out, despite multiple reminders. My husband and I are courteous by nature. Maybe we would have been served faster if we&#39;d pitched a fit. At one point, waiter took my husband&#39;s drink to refill it. For ten minutes my husband had nothing to drink because it took so long to bring it back. This is not an unusual experience. It&#39;s been like that every time. Slow, slow, slow, every time. I get it, it&#39;s a busy place. But it&#39;s not like they&#39;re surprised by it. Have the staff on hand to manage your crowd! As good as the food is, I doubt we&#39;ll be back. Maggiano&#39;s next door is almost as good, and you won&#39;t get old and gray waiting for your food.

The food is delicious BUT the wait for food is ridiculously long at this location. We didn&#39;t receive our food until 1 hour after we placed it. I gave this Cheesecake serval visits and they have been consistently slow.<br>I won&#39;t be going back to this location.

We checked out this location on a typical Friday night and we ordered grilled artichokes as appetizers and steak and pasta for main course. We started with artichokes and were half way don that my wife found a live worm on it (the picture is attached). As you can imagine it ruined our appetite. We asked for the manager and he tried to discredit our claim but he couldn&#39;t since the worm was alive and moving. It took a very long time to bring our order and they brought the stake first without a steak knife!  It took them another 5 minutes to bring the pasta and a knife. At the end we asked for a check and they brought us a check! <br><br>The service was awful and the food was bad. I do not recommend this location to anybody else.

The waitresses name is Chelsea and she was absolutely wonderful , our 30 minutes for two people I had the marsala chicken and asparagus tender asparagus tender chicken mashed potatoes still had a couple chunks of potatoes in it but they were delicious with the wine gravy appetites is there was  spicy chicken avocado egg roll they were delicious my daughter had the shrimp scampi with extra sauce we have no complaints about the cheesecake factory absolutely absolutely wonderful customer service wonderful

So here&#39;s my review. Me and a crew of about 12 came out here for dinner. Well we made reservations at 7pm, we didn&#39;t sit down until around 930pm. We didn&#39;t start getting our food until 1045 very close to 11pm to which they were handing plates out to us one at a time! So it must&#39;ve been very short staffed there because our waiter had to also bring out the food by himself. Most of us really enjoyed the food a few complained but overall it was not really a good really a good experience. The poor waiter really tried his best to accommodate us being that we were such a large crowd. Im giving it 4 stars because the menu selection was awesome, and because of the extremely long wait the management did give us appetizers for free. I will be giving The Cheesecake Factory another chance because I know its a great restaurant.

This place gets busier during weekend. They have a wide range of food menus and services are good. The cheesecake Factory is always a nice place to dine with groups. We had a bit of wait for our foods, but everything was tasty and delicious. will come back soon!

My last visit here was this past Sat, 8/29. The wait wasn&#39;t too bad, even though the line was out the door. We were seated in a booth. Since the aisles are so narrow, we had to put the baby&#39;s stroller near the narrow-door entrance, not the main entrance. <br><br>I ordered the fish tacos. They were devine. The first two were so good. You know how something has such a distinct taste that after awhile, your taste buds get over them quickly? No? Okay, maybe it&#39;s just me. After the first two, I was asking for a taste of my partner&#39;s Shepard&#39;s Pie, which was SOOO good. I almost wished I&#39;d ordered that. Maybe I will next time.<br><br>The fish tacos had a nice seasoning, helping of guacamole, and a sweet sauce. Loved it. Just got tired of the taste after the first couple. <br><br>I also ordered the Apple Crisp instead of cheesecake, since I&#39;m not a cheesecake fan. Well, this place is called the Cheesecake Factory, so perhaps, I should have tried out one of &#39;em. The Apple Crisp was disappointing. I&#39;m not a fan of nuts, so the fact that the entire bottom of the dessert was a layer of pecans was disappointing. I totally missed that part on the menu. Yeah... quite disappointing. <br><br>Our waitress took a long time to do anything, granted it was a Saturday. The wait was awful. Our cups sat empty for most of the time we were here. I forget her name.<br><br>I&#39;ll try the Shepard&#39;s Pie next time I come here and perhaps, a cheesecake finally.  ;)
Food was awesome. Service not so good. I had to ask 3 times for bread. Was not really served just in passing. Food was hot, fresh, and really good. I had Spicy Cashew Chicken and it was amazing.

We&#39;ve enjoyed better meals at other Cheesecake Factory locations in other cities. This one was only ok. Granted, we were seated rather quickly (less than 15 minutes), and our waitress was professional and polite. However, the service was SLOW. We only ordered appetizers, salad, and a child&#39;s plate of pasta and had to wait upwards of an hour. When the food arrived, my daughter&#39;s pasta was room temperature and undercooked.  My salad did not show up until well after all other food was delivered.<br>  Then there is the issue of climate control. You can hang meat in this place. Absolutely FREEZING. My wife shivered near me for the entire meal. We appreciate a cool atmosphere, but not sub-arctic. Ladies:  if you attend this venue in summer clothing, be sure to bring a shawl or jacket. <br>  Oh, the air ventilation ducts drop water too. On guests while they dine. <br>  Will not return to this CF venue again.

3rd time here smh<br>30 minute wait time for party of 3 ... we were sat in 20 minutes which was great for Sunday brunch.<br>Took approximately 5 mins for the server to greet us.  Took about 15 minutes for her to return with our drinks and we had to ask for bread. <br>We ordered chicken n waffles, french toast, and kids pancake breakfast.  It took over an hour for us to receive our food from when we gave our waitress our order. <br>3 tables near us with different servers sat down after us, ordered ate and paid before we even got our food.  I had to go find a manager bc our waitress disappeared and we still did not have our food.  First one said she would check bc it had only been about 30 minutes since we ordered BIG LIE. A male manager came to the table and stated he was sorry blah blah blah food should be out in 10 minutes and he would comp our food for the wait.  Food staggered out 10 minutes later.  It was good but we waited over an hour for our food.  Never got any refills and the bill came (thats when our waitress re-appeared) the managers only took the kids meal off which was $6!  We didnt say anything, we just paid and left quickly.  This was horrible customer service.

I met up with a friend, who had been shopping, to catch up on some girl time over dessert.<br><br>Typical Cheesecake Factory setting.  We were seated immediately around 7PM on a Tuesday.  Our server was attentive.<br><br>I ordered a Piña Colada and Black Out Cake.  The drink was not delicious, the cake was very dense and not cake-like, and the almonds on the outer edge were a little soft and not crisp.<br><br>I also ordered an Oreo Cheesecake concoction to go for my husband, he enjoyed it.

Our food was good. Our server was fair. The food runners that brought our food to the table were terrible. They pretty much threw the plates on the table.  I don&#39;t care how delicious the food is, if you don&#39;t have a friendly, attitude free staff, people will stop coming.  We will not be back! I would try another location, but will never visit this location again.

This place is so slow it&#39;s ridiculous. After today&#39;s visit I am not coming back. Took 40 minutes to receive our app - tamale cakes, and our drinks were perpetually empty. Our meals took 20 more minutes after apps were dropped. We asked for the dessert menu when the meals were dropped off because of how long everything took. But our server only returned after we were long finished, roughly 15 - 20 minutes after finishing. Good thing there wasn&#39;t anything wrong with our meals, besides being mediocre. We ordered a cheesecake togo, and it took 20 minutes! <br><br>We were there almost two hours. &#39;Ain&#39;t nobody got time for dat!&#39; I think I&#39;m actually gray from the wait now. Never again.

In my opinion the food was average as well as the service. I ordered the chicken piccata and the quantity looked like it was from the kids menu. Granted it was from the lunch special, but come on its spaghetti how much could it cost. In regards to the service, it took a minute for our waiter to arrive at are table, but once he was around he did a good job. <br>It&#39;s a shame. I really like the place. It&#39;s decorations, location, and atmosphere can make this place a top 5 in any state or country.

My review is solely based on my visiting this location for takeout. I try not to come on the weekend because the parking lot is jammed packed to the brim! Luckily the restaurant has three parking spots in the front for guests who are solely there for takeout. Look carefully and you can spot them. When inside, the restaurant is huge! The takeout line usually goes very fast especially if you are in a rush. I always get the ultimate red velvet cheesecake and it is THE BEST CHEESECAKE I HAVE EVER TASTED! It is about $8 for a slice but it is definitely worth every penny! It is very rich and cannot be eaten in one sitting. I will definitely keep coming back for my fix. The staff there is always nice and the restaurant itself is very elaborate yet intimate.

I usually enjoy going to the Cheesecake Factory however, the service and the food were not very good during my recent visit. The restaurant was not busy, and there were plenty of empty tables. However, we waited 10 minutes before anyone came to our table to take our drink orders. I ordered water with lemon. The server gave me a plate of lemon slices that were old and dried out. Due to the appearance of the lemon slices, I decided not to use to them in my water. We placed our food order, it took at least 30 minutes before our entrees were delivered. We thought that maybe the server had forgotten to put our order in. The server did not bring us bread as they usually do before the meal. So we were just about to ask for bread when the server delivered our food. Our food was served lukewarm! After waiting for over 30 minutes, you would think that our food would be hot!

Cheesecake as far as the eye can see and a menu so overwhelming you will need a bookmark, but you can&#39;t make a mistake. A date night favorite and good for groups. <br><br>They don&#39;t take reservations though, which is super inconvenient

Is there a restaurant where the people frown and hate their jobs more than here? Maybe the underachieving Corner Taquería in Smyrna, but I&#39;m hard-pressed to think of any others.  It&#39;s depressing.  Lots of potential in a great location.  The food is OK.<br><br>Try this:  order carry out, walk to the pick up section in the back, and see how many people  walk right by you avoiding eye contact , and see how long you can go without anyone asking how they could help, if you have been helped, etc. <br><br>The only way to get your order is to literally wave your hand and desperately try to make eye contact with someone, and then when you ask who can help with your to go order, they often shrug and say, &#34;some lady does that stuff, but I have no idea what her name is.&#34;  <br><br>Even the so-called managers look visibly stressed and see you as someone who is just making them work harder. They are EXPERTS at avoiding eye contact and ignoring guests.  I can sense tension in the team, the coworkers don&#39;t like one another, and disdain their managers.  <br><br>And it reflects in how they treat their customers.  Ultimately disrespectful for an establishment that is in the business of serving people.  <br><br>No one knows who does what, no on takes ownership, and absolutely no one cares about customers when you walk in as a carry out guest.<br><br>I hope Cheesecake learns to maximize their potential and step their game up.  And it starts with the people.

Called to place a to go order and was given a 15-20 minute window for when my food items would be ready.    Love how my food was ready shorter than that.  I mean, why wait longer than necessary right?<br>Okay, now this is what sets them apart from other restaurants I&#39;ve placed togo orders with.  You know that sourdough and wheat bread they serve while your waiting for your food?  You know...it&#39;s  oooooh sooooo good and you can make a meal out  of it?   Well hold on to your seats because the person that took my order, asked if I wanted some to go with my meal along with the butter.   But of course I exclaimed!!!   Most restaurants only save that for dining in or will actually charge you for it. This was the first time The Cheesecake Factory offered to do that and I am no stranger to The Cheesecake factory - nice touch.

The Cheesecake Factory has an impressively large menu which makes it easy for everyone to find something they like. They have really good gluten free options and lunch vs. dinner portions if you are looking for smaller meals. I also recently had Sunday brunch there for the first time and was pleased with their breakfast options.

1. The wait can be long depending on when you go. It&#39;s in a mall so the weekend can be a long wait or any type of holiday.<br>2. The restaurant is medium, the seating can be cramped due to the overwhelming crowds.<br>3. The wait staff is usually good, it&#39;s only been one time the waitress was not to my liking.<br>4. The food here is decent, I preferred the buckhead location better before they moved to lenox.<br>5. Parking is a pain in the ass, like I said it&#39;s in the mall. You can valet but I&#39;d rather walk.<br>6. You have to request for your bread to be warm and your butter not to be little frozen blocks of butter. When I asked the waitress did she have either warm bread or room temperature butter she looked at me like 0_o I&#39;m like *_* miss you can&#39;t spread ice cold butter on cold bread. She appeared to have an attitude. I laughed it off.<br>7. Came here with my bestie she wasn&#39;t thrilled about the company so she was ready to go. We had appetizers and split.<br>8. They have good cheesecake, the bakery bar is this this locations saving grace. They always move quick, are professional, and knowledgeable about the desserts. <br>9. Giving 3 out of 5 stars because I can&#39;t give 3.5 they need to work on keeping the restrooms clean, having the food come out warm and not room temperature, the servers could have better demeanors but I know how it is dealing with idiots, hood rats, the undecisive, people that complain about everything, and the lunatics with their requests of hot water smh do us all a favor and just eat at home or get the plastic to go utensils! The food used to be good but now certain dishes have slacked up, like less shrimp, or 2 less wings, 3 less steak medallions, etc and yet the prices keep creeping up. <br>10. Good place worth checking out some people love cheesecake factory like me but I&#39;ve encountered people who absolutely hate it **shrugs**
When you go for a delicious meal at Cumberland , it would be very very wise to ask for the best server in town  AnthonyStarkey......A great addition to this restaurant...Adrienne Leeds

I frequently eat at the Cheesecake Factory in different locations. This visit was a little off. Our waitress was nice enough but not attentive. She never brought bread to the table and I eventually canceled my soup since it had not arrived before my meal. This seemed surprising to her smh
The hostess is very rude, very bad service, wouldn&#39;t recommend it to anyone. The brand chseececake factory will go down hill because of locations like this

Came In On A Late Saturday Evening. No Reservation But Got Seated Very Quickly. Our Server Autumn Was Very Pleasant And Very Attentive To Our Needs ! Great Demeanor. I Had The Bang Bang Shrimp And Chicken Very Tasteful ! My Girlfriend Had The Chicken And Shrimp Gumbo Also Good. Just Maybe A Tad Bit More Flavor And A Plethora Of Cheesecakes . Amazing Night with An Good Server . Ask For Autumn
Super busy place on the weekends but that&#39;s to be expected! The cheesecake is the main reason to go but the food isn&#39;t half bad either.

I was really hoping to like my first trip to the Cheesecake Factory... but it was a disaster.  It&#39;s a full 1 Star for the ambiance, tables are stacked on top of each other, there is no way to have a conversation with your significant other without having at least 4 others listen along... music was blaring so you had to yell... and tables were tiny that barely fit both our entree plates.  It&#39;s a 1 Star for service, it just sucked, empty glasses not being refilled, food took forever, and she screwed up the order (wanted orange chicken got honey truffle chicken).  It&#39;s a 1-star for value, no way our meal and service was worth $70.  It&#39;s a mediocre 2-3 stars on the actual food, it was ok, not terrible but in no way worth what they charged.<br><br>Please go somewhere else, it&#39;s not worth it.
Huge portions, huge slices of cheesecake, good drinks, decent customer service, mediocre price tag, but always a wait.

This was the worst experience ever. It was my line sister&#39;s birthday. We had a party of 9. We arrived at 5:15 didn&#39;t get seated until 7:30. Our waitress Walida didn&#39;t seem to want our table because i informed her that 3 friends were parking. She had an attitude walked off and came back to take drink orders. The other three guests arrived shortly after. Bread was brought out immediately. The drinks were brought out after 15 minutes, one received her drink a strawberry lemonade late. And so did one male guest after I attempted to inform the waitress that the party was complete so that the additional people could have their drinks put in. It took her about 20 minutes to come out with the pad to take food orders. After a 45 minute wait for food, our entrees arrive and one was completely forgotten about, the 4 cheese pasta for JD, my friend Kaila&#39;s tacos were cold and my eggplant parm was burned and covered with sauce and Luke warm. Desmond&#39;s wonton appetizer was also cold. Angelica&#39;s mashed potatoes were clumpy and hard and she wanted them made over. The waitress apologized and brought a manager to our table. She explained that she could put the mashed potatoes in the warmer and my line sister explained that she wanted fresh food cooked. 4 of us sent back food, 3 of us did not want it remade. My fried cheese was salty. And it took 40 min for the check and our waitress had to be reminded for refills. She was extremely sincere about the food issues, but every one was upset. After waiting for hours to eat we expected hot fresh food. Not luke warm, cold, food that had been prepared and sat on the window. No one liked their food they were just ready to go. And it affected our going out plans because we left at almost 10 PM. It took 25 min for the waitress to bring out 4 cheese cakes. It was horrible. I&#39;d never return for a special event. It was completely ruined.

What can I say about this place that you don&#39;t already know. I had the Shrimp and Chicken Jambalaya and it was AWESOME!!!! I took home a slice of Red Velvet and Oreo Cheesecake! They are my absolute favorites!!!

Went to the Cumberland Mall location on a Friday night and was seated immediately. The decor is everything and I know from previous experience that the cheesecakes are bomb. <br><br>However, I would NOT recommend the Shrimp &amp; Chicken Gumbo, b/c it was hella bland. It was so bland that I decided to eat it for lunch and/or dinner, but forgot to grab the leftovers on the way out. Blah. Like, if Cheesecake Factory &amp; I ain&#39;t go way back; the meal would&#39;ve earned it a 3/3.5 star rating. <br><br>I would definitely recommend the Pineapple Moscow Mule though! My date ain&#39;t much of a drinker and he thought it was good too.

I love Cheesecake Factory! If you are in the mood for sweets, may I suggest venturing out of their cheesecakes and try any of their chocolate cakes?? they are huge and decadent so I suggest to have at least 2 people work on that baby ... maybe even 4 people for every slice ... SERIOUSLY!! Now i forgot the name of the cake I had the last time, but it had three different layers of chocolate with all kinds of other chocolate stuff around it.<br><br>Now, make sure you have a reservation and patience during their peak hours, cuz the wait can be long. <br><br>I definitely enjoy their free bread and soft butter/margarine while you wait for your ordered meal. They have white and wheat bread to choose from. The only thing about this is that you need to sorta kinda control yourself because it is unlimited and it is so easy to fill up on these things before your actual meal comes. <br><br>Most of their pasta dishes are huge and can be split with two people. So, unless you are just hell-bent on devouring some food that day, i would say that splitting one pasta entree between two people is the perfect portion per person. We always have the chicken scampi, and it is always on point. <br><br>I do not suggest their miso salmon on rice - if you are familiar with what actual miso really is ... It is nowhere near the Japanese miso that we envisioned ... it was more like teriyaki salmon. Eek. <br><br>Their meal easily range from $12-30 so it is really up to you how to make the most out of your money and meal. They have a HUGE selection on food and prices really varies due to this. <br><br>I suggest to try it once and see for yourself. Cheesecake Factory is definitely one of those places that you either love or hate.

Cheesecake Factory is probably my favorite chain restaurant - mid price range. We always gets either the avocado egg roll or chicken egg rolls to share. Both awesome. The dinner portions are enough for 2 people to share. Huge portions! I love the Louisiana chicken pasta. Comes with crispy breaded chicken. So good. Macadamia nut cheesecake is my fav too.

Visited this particular Cheesecake Factory for the first time over the Labor Day weekend. The service was wonderful! I ordered the fried cheese as an appetizer, the Louisiana chicken pasta for my entree, and the tuxedo cheesecake for dessert. All three were absolutely delicious! This cheesecake is absolutely mind-blowing, some may even say life changing. My friend got the vanilla bean cheesecake, and it was unbelievable. Overall we were very pleased with our visit and will be coming back next time we are in the area!

Today I ordered their veggie burger and specifically asked if it is made fresh as I wanted to feed my 14 month old.. they said they make it fresh. I did not realize when it was hot but once it was cold I could smell rotten patty and it was even sticky...<br>I am really worried about food poisoning for my 14 month old..<br>Make sure you don&#39;t order this item in the menu ever again..

Went tonight for dinner. Service was excellent. The host and our waitress were friendly and attentive. The waitress had a full knowledge of the large menu. Service is always excellent at this location. If you are looking for a healthy option, try the Skinnylicious Mexican chicken tortilla salad. It is huge! Split it with another person. It was so good and flavorful!

The WORST place for food allergies or dietary restrictions. I went to two different events here and both times left hungry and pissed! The first time I was told there was NOTHING I could eat and that the staff was in a meeting so there was NO one to answer questions anyway. The second time the chef told me he personally would make my meal and be sure I left happy! My food came with a mysterious sauce and of course I couldn&#39;t eat it. The chef apologized he had passed it off to someone else. The manager and Chef were shocked I didn&#39;t want to try another dish and were very rude about comping my meal and drink. But if the point of a restaurant is feeding people and you can&#39;t do that then you shouldn&#39;t charge them! And let&#39;s be real how hard is it to grill some chicken in a pan with butter and garlic or maybe fresh herbs. I mean any Chef should be able to cook something! And unfortunately since then others have had similar experiences! So if you&#39;re in the area go next door Ted&#39;s or Maggiano&#39;s are amazing with food allergies and happy to feed you!

I like CF obviously because of the red velvet cheesecake. I go here mostly just to get that. One Sunday I had a gift card and decided to sit at the bar and order. I ordered the Chicken Madeira, the bartender said it was the most popular chicken dish. It also indicated that in the menu. I also ordered the special house made lemonade. I believe there are no free refills on that so sip slowly although that was a struggle (it&#39;s reallly good lemonade). I&#39;m not sure why the chicken madeira is the menu favorite, it wasn&#39;t over the moon good. In fact, I won&#39;t order it the next time I eat here. It was ok, mostly the sauce made the dish. The dish consists of sauteed chicken breast topped with fresh asparagus and melted mozzarella cheese, covered with fresh mushroom madeira sauce. Served with mashed potatoes. I don&#39;t know what madeira sauce is but it&#39;s similar to carbonara sauce. I believe it&#39;s a wine based sauce. Anywhoo, the chicken was a little rubbery for me. The melted cheese on top gave it a tangy flavor which would have been excellent if the cheese was actually melted all the way. The asparagus was amazing and so were the potatoes. But I found myself picking through the chicken to find good pieces. Maybe I just had a bad batch. I also ordered the Salted Caramel Cheesecake to go. It was really really tasty, but nothing beats the red velvet I&#39;m sorry. It took me 3 days to eat that one piece of cheesecake though so maybe I wasn&#39;t really feeling it. I&#39;ll be back for sure because this place has good service and consistent food. I&#39;ll try some of the cocktails one day, I heard they have a happy hour.

The worst experience we ever had in the Cheesecake Factory. We arrived around 3 pm and  about 3:40 we were seated. Ordered everything with the drinks so that way we can get it fast. It was a very long time until we got our appetizers and it was very very cold( avocado egg rolls) which I know are usually hot. Everything came so late even one of my entries the pasta was very cold. Service really needs to be improved at this location. Won&#39;t be coming here again.

Came to this location recently for our friend&#39;s daughter&#39;s birthday. Awful experience. <br>First of all this location is ALWAYS crowded.  One of the main reasons I hate coming here.  But it wasn&#39;t my choice, so I was a good little soldier and didn&#39;t complain. At first. <br>Now it&#39;s not necessarily their fault that they&#39;re a popular franchise in a high-traffic location, but if they managed it better it could possibly work. <br>We had a large party, so I figured that our friend had made some sort of reservation.<br>Well.<br>It turns out that The Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t DO reservations. I know, crazy right? I had no idea either! <br>So we were forced to wait. And wait. <br>For more than two and a half hours until they could accommodate us. <br>In the meantime, we watched smaller party after smaller party get seated ahead of us and proceed to occupy tables LONG after they were finished eating their meals. <br>And once we were finally seated, we still weren&#39;t all seated together.  Sigh. <br>Oh well, on to the food...<br>The long wait meant that we didn&#39;t get served until after 10pm. Way too late for my over-40 butt to be eating anything spicy. Regardless, I ordered the Shrimp and Chicken Gumbo. <br>A few measly shrimp, bland broth and some chewy, gristle-y chicken. <br>I thought the late meal time was the reason I started feeling nauseated a few bites in, so I stopped eating and asked for a to-go box so I could order what I really came for: Oreo Cheesecake. <br>It was great.  <br>One thing The Cheesecake Factory never gets wrong is, well, cheesecake. Maybe they should just focus on that and not food.  Because the next day when I reheated that gumbo it made me nauseated all over again and I threw it away. <br>Happy birthday Sadeja. Love you kiddo...<br>But please don&#39;t invite me next time.
Love this place. The food consistently taste amazing. The menu is huge and pleases all palates. The cheese cake is down right delicious.

It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory, so the food is consistent.  I did find it odd that my food was missing one of the main ingredients, mushrooms.  I thought I had the wrong dish.  <br><br>My waitress was very nice, but the service was very slow. At 10pm with a mostly empty restaurant, she had no excuse.

my review is not about the cheesecake, but the actual dine in service and meal experience. I was not satisfied at all. The food was awful. They messed up on my sister&#39;s order....but yes they didn&#39;t have an issue with re doing it right...which is a plus bc we weren&#39;t rude about it. They were slow af with getting the drinks and apps out...like the place wasn&#39;t even busy when we got there. I didn&#39;t pay 40 bucks for slow service and burnt food..  I was told that the food wasn&#39;t great here but i had to see for myself and  now i wish i would have listened...

Had a horrible  experience.  There was no line or wait but was directed to stand at a dirty table until  the  busser came  over to clean the table. There were 3 empty  clean tables  to our left so we sat in one of those.  The hostess flew over  to tell us we  couldn&#39;t  sit there and waved the manager over. The manager  said that&#39;s not  how things go here and moved us back  to the dirty table. The whole time  someone could have  been cleaning  instead of directing  us to the dirty tables  instead of the empty clean ones. Rude. An awful experience.  Will  not return

Very unsanitary!! They cleaned the tables off with the dirty dish rag, wiping every onto the seat &amp; then placed the silverware onto the bare table. They could have at least put the silverware on the napkin that was on the saucer.<br>The service was super slow!!! It took about 10 minutes before the waiter came to take our drink order. By the time he brought the drinks, I didn&#39;t want an appetizer, I just wanted to order my entree. I also ordered my desert (to go) way before he brought the check so that I wouldn&#39;t have to wait forever on it. <br>The food however was delicious! 2 stars for the food only.

My family and I love the Cheesecake Factory! We usually frequent this location because it&#39;s the closest one to us. Like all Cheesecake Factory, be prepared to wait. The wait is always long and they do not take reservations. <br>The food here are delicious! We&#39;ve tried many items here from their pork chops, meat loaf, pizzas, burgers, pastas, steaks etc. They have a huge menu! My favorite here is probably the blackened Jamaican shrimp and their kale salad. But really they have a lot of good menu items here. It&#39;s one of my family&#39;s favorite restaurant chain. <br>Almost forgot, they have all kinds of flavors of cheesecake. I&#39;m not a big fan of sweets but I do try a bite whenever my hubby or boys order one and they&#39;re delicious!

We have typically had decent food/ service here in the past, but it has gotten worse. Our server charged us for kids drinks even though the menu clearly says that a drink is included with a kids meal. When I mentioned it to our server, he argued with me. I guess i will just start getting my cheesecake to go.

When we first got there, it was a 15 to 20 minute wait.....50 empty tables in plain site. Food was AWESOME,  but the waiter took 10 minutes for any thing we asked for, or he went to get. Food great, staff poor, all those empty tables and we had to wait ?

Arrived at the Cheesecake Factory and we waited 40 mins not a big deal it was busy we were seated ordered our food when it finally came out it was cold smh we asked for a manger when he decided to come to our table he told us he could reheat the food (basically put it in the microwave) and said how it would be hot when it came out at this point he was pressuring us to hurry up and make a decision on eating the food or leaving another manager did a follow up and said she could give us 50% off of the microwave food I said no thank and we left never again at least at this location

I went to here for a late lunch today.  An estimated hour lunch turned into two hours.  I ordered the crab and artichoke dip for my appetizer.  Can you say 30 minutes for dip!!  I only got it in 30 minutes because I prompted my waiter to check on it.  Then once it came out it was like warm.  I rolled with it because at that point I was starving.  I ordered the bbq ranch chicken salad for my entree.  It was heavy on the veggies and slim on the chicken.  Well at least my strawberry lemonade was good, I guess.

If you go to this place after 4pm on a Saturday, be prepare to wait an hour - 2 hours.  I&#39;ve going to this location for years with my wife and child, and I will say this was the worst experience I&#39;ve had.  The crowd has grown over the years and this seems to have affect their customer service.  The lady at the front counter came no where close to spelling my last name &#34;Fleming&#34; when were checking in for our 1 hour 45 min wait time.  So when our buzzer went off we were to told to stand off to the side and they will call our name.  The guy looked at the piece of paper that was printed out with our name on it.  He hesitated and yelled out something no where near &#34;Fleming&#34; and my wife approached him and said &#34;don&#39;t you mean &#39;Fleming&#39;&#34;?  He laughed, shook his head and apologize and seated us.<br><br>I hate sitting next to big parties and that&#39;s where we ended.  It seems like this place brings out  all the less desirable people who want to loud and need to be seen.  An that&#39;s who we were seated next to.  The waitress was pleasant.  They have cut back on the brown bread.  I ordered the Spicy Cashew Chicken.  They cut back on portions, but that&#39;s not a big deal.  I began eating and it didn&#39;t taste the same.  I further inspected and found just about all of the cashews were burnt, not charred or roasted, but burnt.  If you saw them you think they were black beans.  I told the waitress, she looked and them and apologized.  I told her I wanted to send it back and didn&#39;t want anything else. The manager came over so he could &#34;verify&#34; the cashews were burnt.  They took it off my bill.<br><br>You know the quality of service and personnel is very low. When you have the audacity to send out food that is clearly burned, you have failed your company.  There was a lot of confusion going on as well.  After we had our food, different wait staff members came to our table with food asking who order what.  We simply told them we already had out food.  They were all over the place taking food to the wrong table and it became annoying.  I was ready to go when this lady who was part of the large party actually asked the waitress &#34;how should I mix my salad&#34;?  The waitress told her to take her 2 forks and toss it / mix it together.  I told my wife it will be a while before I eat here again.  The Cheesecake Factory is nothing more than an over sized Applebee&#39;s.
I came from Columbus Georgia to enjoy the Cheesecake Factory worst experience of my like I&#39;ve reached out since Saturday 11-11-17 still no response

I had such a horrible experience at the cheesecake factory at the Cumberland Mall. It started by me getting there at 11:40 AM which we all know is early lunch and not a rush yet. However I found myself waiting over five minutes for someone to greet us and give us a seat. The waiter does not reflect the experience that I had, he was great! I asked the waiter his opinion on the crab bites. He said that they were good and he doesn&#39;t even eat seafood. So I order them and they came out quickly but to my dismay they were disgusting. I sent them back and ordered the brussels sprouts. They came and they were tasty until I realized they were dry on the 2nd bite; the Brussel sprouts did not have the sauce that was described in the menu. The table was dirty that I noticed after we sat for a while but to top it all off, you wouldn&#39;t believe that the hamburger kids meal that I ordered for my three-year-old daughter that the meat was spoiled. I tasted it and spit it out immediately and even had the waiter tastic who confirmed it was spoiled. They took off the kids meal but at this point I just felt like my entire bill should&#39;ve been cut which was equivalent to $23. I called over the manager and explained my horrible experience and she said because I&#39;d eat in the brussels sprouts she couldn&#39;t count that off.  I let her know I will never be returning.

The food here is always below standard. Incredibly bland the only good thing at the cheese cake factory is the drinks and maybe the desert. I Took a chance at the gumbo and oh my goodness it was incredibly tasteless.

My daughter and I visited the Cheesecake Factory this evening and I made the worst mistake ever.  I ordered the wrong entree.  I get the same thing every time (The Farfalle pasta). For some reason I accidentally ordered the chicken Marsala with mushrooms, which I&#39;ve had before but didn&#39;t particularly care for it.  I  ordered one for my daughter and one for me. Once the food arrived I immediately realized the mistake.  I apologized to the waitteress and she said it wasn&#39;t a problem and she would call the manager over and replace it with the one I wanted. She was very nice about the situation.  I hate that I forgot her name. <br><br> Once the manager came over he wasn&#39;t very happy at all and I could tell that he was irritated ( I forgot his name). Once he displayed his frustration I was no longer interested in having my meal replaced.  As I was preparing to pay for the drinks and appetizer the waitress comes back and I tell her we are just gonna skip dinner because the manager wasn&#39;t happy and I wasn&#39;t comfortable ordering another dish. She told me that she would get the general manager.  His name is Alex.  OMG ALEX...he came over tapped me on the back of my hand and told me shame on me in a very playful manner lol.  He was very friendly nice and understanding.  He said that it was no problem and I felt comfortable ordering our dishes.  Not only was ALEX a sweetheart, he was also very handsome.  IJS.  Thank you Alex you were awesome and you rock.  I appreciate you.

The wait to be seated took twenty-five minutes. Then when we were seated everything was swell our waitress brought us bread and butter, then we ordered our meals I ordered the roadhouse sliders. The sliders were seasoned good two out of the four sliders were burnt, but the others had a good taste. My mother ordered the seared tuna titaki salad which was very good the tuna was seared perfectly and the greens of the salad were fresh. We had ordered an app. of calamari  which the waitress had mistake for cauliflower, I will let that little mistake slide since the music was pretty loud in the restaurant. Overall  I probably will come back again.

We just left, and we usually love TCF but tonight was awful.  We had Diane as our waitress, I don&#39;t know if it was her, the kitchen or a combination of both(likely): but whatever the case, if this dinner was a person it def grabs unexpecting reporters by the p***y and uses the wrong email server. We sat down at 6:25 and left at 8:40, we couldn&#39;t even order dessert as my girls, 4 &amp; 5 yrs, were melting down from lack of patience after waiting for over 2+ hours for a simple meal. I got the steak Diane (ironically) I asked for med. rare, got it well done, leathery and bland; I know, I can hear your taste buds watering.  My oldest got the chicken Riesling w/o onions - the dish arrived and it felt like she must have heard extra onions cause they piled them on. But the shear amount of time it took to do the simple things - get a drink, for our entree&#39;s to arrive, for us to get service was unacceptable, there was a stretch where we didn&#39;t see our waitress for 30 min. We didn&#39;t even have time to complain. We wound up getting dessert from the Togo counter, cause it&#39;s one of the main draws at TCF (namesake), and it was great, but we ate it at home in our pj&#39;s.

They need new hostesses. They are kind of rude and inattentive. They are like machines... Give your name.. Give you a buzzer and move aside. That&#39;s the feeling atleast. The food is well food... It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory. This location is just ok

I love the Cheesecake Factory. Cheesy?! Well so what? It&#39;s like Houstons or papadeuxs (always good quality food)  but with a huge menu. It&#39;s a chain but it&#39;s consistent and they can get away with their massive menu bc everything on it is delicious!!! I&#39;ve never had anything that I didn&#39;t like. The portions are huge they always have good service and the lighting couldn&#39;t be better.  And the bread?!!  Swoon! Love that! Over the years I&#39;ve been partial to the chicken piccata the pecan crusted fish ...the burgers..the salads... You get my drift...Last time I got the sausage ricotta flat bread which was only 6.95 and quite good.... I&#39;m not a fan of sweets but the Godiva cheesecake will make me make an exception. It&#39;s a good place for dates and business meetings and if you bring someone here that can&#39;t find something on the menu their ass needs to be dropped off at home. Go!

This will be a very short review. The only thing I can give a review on is those awesome cakes they have to offer. I have to admit I&#39;ve NEVER sat i sideand had their food before.  Whenever I come its always at a rush for a few slices of different flavors of cakes and cheesecakes. With that along this is why I keep coming back. I will change my 3 star review once i have eaten there.

Hit or miss depending on the cook. This place is crazy busy and the staff has yet to get a handle on how direct the flow of traffic. Anyway, I usually order to go and I get the Chipotle Chicken pasta sub for Shrimp. I tell you this is one delicious dish when made correctly. I cross my fingers and hope its right when I get home. Usually its 50/50 chance that they get it right. I&#39;m a optimist. Last week I ordered and it was not good at all it lacked the chipotle sauce the shrimp was small overall flavor was weak, the previous week it was amazing. I wish I knew who prepared the food so I can always request that person.

I don&#39;t come here for the food, just the cheesecake. The food is just mediocre, but the cheesecake is fantastic. It&#39;s rich and decadent and well worth the price tag if you consider the fact that you can easily split one slice in half and have enough dessert for two meals. The staff is nice enough. The cheesecake is just as consistently good as at their other chain locations. Even during peak hours, they get you in and out pretty quickly, which is nice. I&#39;d give it 5 stars if the food were actually great, but it&#39;s just a mediocre stomach filler. I&#39;ve never WANTED any food from here. Just the cheesecake that the place is named for.

EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTING! The food was GARBAGE! I ordered blackened chicken fettuccini and when it came out it was not blackened. The fettuccini sauce had absolutely no flavor. Way over priced! Will never go back!

We are visiting from ChicagoHostesses have no personalities.  Waited over an hour. Was told several times that should be few minutes that turned to 10-15 minutes. <br><br>Finally got seated.  Server greeted and we immediately gave our orders. Has been over 10 minutes and just brought our drinks. Still waiting for our bread. And finally got our bread and butter.  And our flatbread appetizer. <br><br>I can&#39;t tell if our server is happy with us or not. Asked for another water and more bread and wasn&#39;t that thrilled about it.<br><br>Food came out. Ordered the Smoked BBQ burger. Well made but lacked the bbq so had to request bbq on the side.  Oriental chicken salad was great. My son ordered fettuccine alfredo without any garnish or herbs. Couldn&#39;t even eat it - it was salty as if it just came out from the ocean. That was comped by the manager. Daughter&#39;s crusted chicken that came with pasta and marinara. Chicken was well made but again the pasta was salty. Tongue felt &#34;numb&#34; from the saltiness. <br><br>Overall the experience at this Cheesecake Factory was bad from the start. Only deserves 2 stars for my burger and the salad.

Came in to use a gift card, otherwise we would have never eaten there. Service was slow, tables dirty. Definitely understaffed. Dishes and silverware were so dirty that we went to the to go counter and got plastic ware. We were there for over two hours. My son had ordered a coffee and while drinking it had a noodle in his mouth from the coffee. So nasty. This place is nasty!

2nd time here and 2nd time walking out after not being served. This time we were there a total of 10 mins. There was no one at the hostess stand not even when we walked out. <br><br>2nd time going to another resturant. Please do something to improve your customer service.

Horrible experience the food and service at this location sucked. Nothing appears fresh and the taste of the crab and artichoke dip horrible. The Farfalle pasta horrible. Rachel our server horrible. We will not be returning!

Sat at the bar for happy hour/bar menu specials. <br><br>This location DOES NOT have drink specials (reasons #1-57843 that I will be going back to the Perimeter Mall location. <br><br>service was slow and bordered on surly. Sat at the bar and wasn&#39;t greeted. Menus were placed in front of us, and the bartender walked away. We waited about 10 minutes for service, menus closed and sat next to us. May have been a one - off but we will not return

We had to wait over an hour to be seated. We arrived at 3 pm!  Anyway, it took forever for us to get anything, even drinks. They did not give us napkins, we had to ask. Our main dish probably took close to an hour to come out. I ordered the shrimp and it came out terrible, the worst shrimp I have ever had. You could tel it had been sitting under the warmer for quite some time. The manager was going around tables telling people sorry for the wait. I told her about my shrimp and she offered a new one and their soup of the day. She said it would take very long, as we had already been there for quite some time and honestly just wanted to leave at that point. The soup never came, the shrimp did finally come after about 20 minutes. It was much better. The manager offered to &#34;take care of my meal.&#34;  We get the receipt and she took care of one of my shrimp plates, which of course they were gonna do because it was bad. I didn&#39;t even bother asking about the soup and why I never got it. The only reason we came here is because we had a gift card. It is close to an hour drive from our house. We probably will never be back.

Can&#39;t even tell you how horrible the service is. Our server was the worst I have ever had! He barely came to check on us.   We ordered a wine and 25 min later  we still had not seen him. we flagged down another server to get our bill and left.  Will not go back!
Great service and that miso salmon was amazing!!

God awful experience.<br><br>Let&#39;s see..currently I have half my meal in front of me. I stopped eating it 10 minutes ago when I ran out of both beer and water.  <br><br>It took over 10 minutes to simply get drinks in the first placed. As in, we ordered drinks, and then didn&#39;t see the server for 10 minutes.<br><br>It took almost a half an hour for our entrees to arrive after ordering.<br><br>I have been here TWO hours now, for one course!!!!  I wanted dessert, but at this point I give up.<br><br>And they are NOT full. No wait. Open tables.<br><br>This is not worth the frustration. I&#39;m gonna go to the bathroom now and drink out of the sink, as nobody has been by as I type this.<br><br>Good luck eating here.
Luv it!!! Best place to enjoy a great meal...   Meatloaf is the best in town!  Fantastic place to visit with friends and family.   Great service and beautiful environment

Hate chain restaurants, but ...... I love this place!!! The food was delicious, I was there celebrating my friends mothers 30th anniversary, so it was a party of 8, we were seated quickly and server waa very attentive, atmosphere was perfect. I finished off my meal with a cheesecake with so many layers they named it outrageous. This is definitely a spot that I will be visiting again soon.

There is not a bad selection at the Cheesecake Factory.  Selection and consistency is truly uncanny.  Salmon was soooo good.  Mastered the art of that firm seared-like exterior yet absolutely perfect, moist, succulent inside.  Smh.  Mango Key Lime slice to go.  Oh!--and cucumber lemonade:). Best lunch I&#39;ve had in a while.

My staples here(nationwide) never seem to change...<br>Avocado rolls &amp; vegan Cobb salad <br>Maybe wine,split cheesecake or none <br><br>My servers 80% of the time are great.<br>Usually it&#39;s kind of a known aspect they don&#39;t take care of you as much as you desire given its always 50 billion people here..but that&#39;s given its so busy,I get it <br><br>My server tonight was ok...not good...ok...blah...no personality or smile...but she did her job...she served food and gave check <br><br>It&#39;s hard to complain when your order wasn&#39;t messed up or your food wasn&#39;t taking too long..but it&#39;s easy to notice somebody who doesn&#39;t want to be at work...or doesn&#39;t want to deal with...ummmm humans lol...<br>All in all...the host was great,the food was as always great and the service was sufficient...

We&#39;re visiting the area just for the weekend and decided to go to the Cheesecake Factory in Cumberland Mall since there&#39;s not a Cheesecake Factory where we live. The hostess Friday night was Amy and apparently she is one of the managers. Worst customer service ever from her. My husband approached the counter to register for a table and Amy didn&#39;t even said a &#34;good night&#34;. She just asked for my husband&#39;s name and told him to stay to the side without any other guidance, she just said &#34;step to the side&#34;. We sat on the side bench to wait for someone to call us to our table. After 19 or 15 minutes we noticed nobody else was waiting, everyone that came in was seated immediately.  My husband went back to the hostess counter and asked Amy for our table and she said there was no wait for a table of three.  My husband told her nobody ever called us and her response was &#34;maybe you gave me the wrong name&#34;.  Agter her terrible customer service thank God our waitress was excellent. Unfortunately since the fish and ships my daughter ate there las night, she&#39;s been in bed vomiting none stop. I&#39;m sure she got food poisoning over what she ate at the Cheesecake Factory. Today we&#39;ve been trying to get in touch with Alex, Amy&#39;s boss and after calling several times and leaving a phone number to be contacted, nobody has taking 4 minutes to calm us back.

The worst experience I ever had! I expected the long wait. However, our server did a horrible job with her service. I purposely ordered the appetizer with the drink order so it would come out early. We waited about 30 minutes before the appetizer finally arrived and when it did, the nachos were cold and the cheese was not melted! So disappointed! Not long after that, about 10 minutes, our meals came out, really?!? The meals were not brought all at once either. First my husband got his lukewarm burger with unmelted cheese, then my daughter who should have gotten her meal first since she ordered off the kid&#39;s menu, received her lukewarm quesadillas and unmelted cheese. Next was my other daughter&#39;s salmon meal, which tasted like spoiled fish. Finally was my meal with over cooked and dry shrimp with angel hair pasta. The whole experience was a mess!!!!. I&#39;ve been here before and had much better service and great tasting food, but the quality of this place is going down! They need to train their staff better on how to serve food and how to dress. Male servers had their pants sagging and the belt was wrapped around their butts rather than their waist. What an awful site to see in a restaurant while you&#39;re eating! Get it together Cheesecake Factory, Cumberland Mall!!!!

I&#39;m here at Cheesecake Factory and I&#39;m close to walking out without paying for the appetizers and drinks because my wife&#39;s meal was Di F**king gusting and my meal was perfectly cold as the movie Ice Age!! I told the manager if I flip my plate upside down my potatoes would fall off the plate because it&#39;s so cold. The only good thing about this visit was the waiter. He was truthful and showed that he at least cared though he couldn&#39;t so anything about the food... This was my last time here.

They have a skinlicious menu with labels for calories amount, which is nice. <br><br>I like their lettuce wraps - 6.95 for 3 - decent price for lunch choices. <br><br>The wraps are well put together and stick together - less messier than I expected. <br><br> They have several flavors - I like the Asian one the most. Mexican ones are a little too plain. <br><br>Overall I think Cheesecake Factory has quality food like pasta, salmon.  - good service and a variety of choices. Nothing too special but something for everyone! <br><br>This thing is this place gets too crazy over the weekend that you need to wait a long time to be seated. For this reason I don&#39;t go this place often.

Two hour wait followed by slow service. When our entrees finally arrived, food was room temperature at best. We ordered dessert to-go when our sub-par entrees arrived, hoping it would be ready by the time we were done eating. No such luck. Finished (or rather picked over our food), paid the check, and still had to wait an additional 20-25 minutes.<br>Years ago, I stopped patronizing this establishment due to poor service. Sad to see, nothing has changed. This is my last visit.

Wow, only go here if you want the worst and slowest service in your life. We were a big group (8 adults) celebrating a big birthday so of course we waited patiently until we were seated. About an hour and 15 minute wait and we were seated. We expected the wait but were ready to order and eat by this time! 35 minutes later, we were finally addressed by our waitress. We were only allowed to order drinks b/c she was the drinks waitress and the main one would come shortly... oookaaay. Ordered our drinks, 26 minutes later we got half our drinks and finally just went to the bar to get the remaining. So almost an hour after we sat down. After complaining to a guy who I assume was the manager, all of a sudden the food was ready and everything started coming out quickly and our waitress developed a smile. 1 hour and 12 minutes later we got our appetizers which we should&#39;ve just cancelled them b/c our entrees came 10mins after them. They sang for the bday dessert but didn&#39;t bother to offer to comp even the one dessert for the birthday. The food was decent as usual, tho one of the orders was still wrong. Will never ever come here again nor recommend it to anyone else. Everyone around us sat down after us and got their drinks and meals before us so it wasn&#39;t just an average busy night. Apparently large groups means you expect your standard 20% tip and can give shitty service.

Today, my wife and I tried a new appetizer &#34;crab bites&#34; they were &#34;insanely delicious&#34; ...we thought since they were so small they would have more bread than lump crab but were we wrong. The chipotle sauce was amazing and complimented the bites extremely well. If you have never tried them I would strongly recommend you do so. <br><br>Tasty bites comes in small portions!

I really enjoyed my visit today our waiter Reno was great he made sure our glasses stayed full and the food was good to except the fish tacos but all in all I was blessed and pleased to pay 74.00 on the meal with a 20.00 tip great service deserve a great reward!!!!

Cumberland Mall sure has grown within the last decade with better stores and restaurants flourishing the area. Even my job have meetings at Maggiano&#39;s there. Cheesecake Factory is right next to Maggiano. I have to admit, I got a really bad experience at Cheesecake Factor a decade ago and never went back. On top of that, I don&#39;t like cheesecake. <br><br>It took some convincing but a co-worker wanted me to try the food and says it&#39;s worth it. I mean after all, it&#39;s been over a decade, right? She was raving about the Mac &amp; Cheese burger and fries. I almost got that...except I don&#39;t eat beef, more like I don&#39;t like beef. If the waitress would&#39;ve offered or suggested putting it on a turkey burger, I would&#39;ve been down to try it. So instead, I got the chicken burger and fries. I was not disappointed at all.<br><br>The restaurant was a lot fancier than I thought and wasn&#39;t as busy either. We went when it was noon. It was harder finding a parking space than being seated. Co-worker wanted to prove to me I just had bad quality cheesecake in the past, so I decided to order the turtle cheesecake. She got the pumpkin cheesecake. We both took dessert to go and ate at our desk. We were very happy.<br><br>I can happily say that I will go back to Cheesecake Factory and order again, especially the cheesecake.

Went to this location and the service was meh and entree was good enough, but my experience changed drastically once it got to the cheesecake aspect of the meal. I asked for the Reese&#39;s cheesecake to go and instead received the peanut butter cup ripple. I didn&#39;t notice because I was in a hurry to leave due to already spending three hours on lunch. However, I am a Reese&#39;s cheesecake fanatic and definitely could tell the difference as soon as I opened the to go box at home. Maybe this should partly be on me for not checking but shouldn&#39;t employees be trained and know the names of the cheesecakes. After all this establishment is called the Cheesecake Factory. Honestly would give this location 0 stars if I could because I do only go to the Cheesecake Factory for CHEESECAKE NOT THE MEDIOCRE FOOD. Not sure if I would try this location again because I spend over 8 dollars on a PIECE of cheesecake when I could get a whole cake for 9 dollars at Publix that would taste significantly better than the Adam&#39;s peanut butter cup fudge ripple cheesecake (also no traces of fudge).

Cheesecake Factory is located in Restaurant Row along the outside of Cumberland Mall.<br><br>While the service and food is always wonderful and friendly, the speed and cost are what knock this down to a three.  When they get very busy, expect to wait a lot longer than normal for a table, and expect the food delivery to take a long while.  But if you come during off times, they are closer to a regular restaurant (albeit even then a little slower).  We always enjoy our food; in the 5-6 times I&#39;ve come here I can only think of one time when one of my kids complained about the food. <br><br>Despite the long waits at times, my kids always choose Cheesecake Factory to celebrate their birthdays- and we continue to oblige.

I&#39;ve been here twice recently (June 2017) - once for dinner and once for dessert.  The night we went for dinner, the restaurant was short-staffed - 1/3 of the tables were empty, yet the hostesses had a 20 minute wait.  It was a weeknight - probably a Wednesday if I had to guess.  We decided to sit in the bar area instead, which wasn&#39;t much better.  Our waiter was overloaded with tables, drinks were extremely slow to come out - to the point where the one drink we each ordered lasted through the dinner, whereas we had intentions of buying a couple of drinks.  We split the avocado egg rolls, which were good, and a pasta dish that was pretty bland.  All in all, we regretted spending our money here.  Then a couple of weeks later, we decided to get a slice of cheesecake to go on a Sunday night at 10pm.  There was a 20 minute wait after ordering the slice of cheesecake before we could walk back out the door to the restaurant.  Let me repeat, a 20-minute wait on a random non-holiday Sunday night.  Then when our order FINALLY came up, the restaurant had run out of the cheesecake that we selected, despite the fact that they had 3 slices of it in the display case when we ordered it (and someone should have noticed that they were running out of that one and gone to get one out of the freezer to thaw).  We had to select a new cheesecake, and no offer was made to try to make up for the fact that we waited 20 minutes for a slice of cheesecake that they didn&#39;t have available.  I highly doubt I will ever go back to this location again, despite it being walking distance from my home.

This is probably one of my favorite places in the Atlanta area. The food is priced well and food quality is worth it anyway. The waiting staff is very kind/enjoyable to interact with, and are always willing to help. The restaurant atmosphere is very beautiful and it&#39;s a great place for groups or for a date night. Also it&#39;s named appropriately, the cheesecake is really what keeps me coming back lets be honest.

Lunch with my co-worker at Cheesecake Factory at Cumberland Mall.<br>If you go around 11:45AM, there is enough seating and you do not have to wait a long time to be seated. Plus you get to beat all the lunch traffic by arriving before noon. And it is much easier to find parking. The server always give you sour dough bread and wheat bread. I prefer the wheat bread. It is softer and has sweet taste to it. We ordered BBQ ranch chicken salad and Garlic noodles. The BARBEQUE RANCH CHICKEN SALAD had Avocado, Tomato, Grilled Corn, Black Beans, Cucumber and Romaine All Tossed with Barbeque Ranch Dressing. And then it was Topped with Lots of Crispy Fried Onion Strings for Crunch. I loved the crunchy and crispy onion rings. The GARLIC NOODLES was a pasta dish. It was Spaghettini, Fresh Asparagus, Shiitake Mushrooms, Oven-Roasted Tomatoes and Parmesan in a Delicious Garlic Sauce. This is a great place to get your salad and pasta fix. Our food came out fairly quickly, but this will not be your 1 hour lunch break. You will need to estimate out to be about a 1.5hr lunch break.<br><br>Server was SO slow and forgetful!

I am VERY disappointed in the customer service I received at The Cheesecake Factory today.  My family and I waited over an hour for our entrees to come out while watching people who sat down after us receive their food before us.  When the food finally came out, my daughters grilled cheese was burnt! And my chicken tacos, rice, and black beans were cold! The waitress quickly got my daughter another order of grilled cheese, and I spoke with the manager about my food.  The manager told me she could get my next order out in 15 to 20 minutes. I asked her to bring it TO-GO. She then asked me if I wanted my toppings on the side, and I responded yes. After waiting for my food, it came out on a plate! And I was told that they would give me half off. When I spoke to the manager, she claimed she did not hear me ask for my order to go , which I know was a LIE because why would you ask if I wanted my toppings in the side then!? Then she tells me because I am taking the food home I have to pay for something.  That is poor customer service at its best! After waiting all this time, watching my other family members enjoy their food, having to send mine back TWICE, you still expect me to pay!? That&#39;s ridiculous.  I will NOT be returning in the future. Idk who trains their managers but someone needs another lesson in customer service 101!!! Smh.

Was hesitant to eat here after seeing the overall rating and reading the reviews. However, I did notice that management responded to most if not all of the reviewers and it shows that they care enough to enforce change. That being said, I arrived last evening with a friend and after a short (10 min) wait, we were seated. Our waitress, Kimberly, was friendly and attentive. My wine arrived quickly and when that glass was emptied, she was asked if I wanted another glass. The apps (Tex Mex eggrolls and Buffalo Blasts) were delicious! Our entrees, Chicken Costoletta and Bistro Shrimp Pasta were really good. I was surprised to see the crowds of people lightening up as we left. It was only 9pm. My water did not taste like butt (saw this in an earlier review), although I thought I smelled bleach in my wine glass. It wasn&#39;t strong enough to cause concern. And I wasn&#39;t sick or anything. If anything, I know the glass was clean! LOL! Anyway, I recommend this location. Food was tasty and staff was nice and accommodating.

Food was good today but honestly it wasn&#39;t hot. Showed it had been setting before ever coming out. Had to ask for Parmesan. It was a pasta dish. Drinks were slow to be refilled....nothing was done quickly tho our waitress seemed to always be in a hurry. Very slow service...were there for 2 hours. It wasn&#39;t for us just sitting and talking.

We had a group of 6 on a Sunday evening and were celebrating a birthday. It was busy and there was a long wait. We finally got seated and half the silverware was dirty. I don&#39;t mean a couple spots, literally chunks of food like pieces of lettuce. How could you miss that? Really concerned me that if this is what is visible to the customer, how is the cleanliness in the kitchen that we can&#39;t see? My daughter was so excited to eat here for her birthday and we had waited about 45 min to get seated, otherwise I would have walked out. We mentioned it to our server and he made a joke that we didn&#39;t even need to order any food since we had some already. This makes me think that it&#39;s a common occurrence. Then, seeing some of the other reviews, I realize it is. Our server, Rico, did the best he could and was overloaded with tables, but the service was extremely slow, food was room temperature, and we had to flag other servers down for anything we needed. For the price of the food and long wait, we were extremely disappointed and will not be going back.

I&#39;d been here twice for lunch, both times to catch up with a wonderful friend I had met at an alumni reception in Durham - she graduated 30 years before me, she loves Cheesecake Factory, it seemed proper to let her pick the restaurant, plus the wide menu selection makes it easier for both parties to find something they like. <br><br>Both times we got the lunch specials which are available every day. And like dinner, lunch portions are also generous - I always have enough leftovers to make another meal, which is why I don&#39;t get the salad. (Who likes soggy salad leftovers?) <br><br>SPICY CHICKEN CHIPOTLE PASTA - $10.95<br>I&#39;d remembered that another friend had told me this is what she always orders. I also remembered having a taste and loving the creamy sauce, and deciding this is what I would get next time. Honey-glazed chicken, asparagus, red &amp; yellow peppers, peas, garlic &amp; onion in spicy chipotle parmesan cream sauce. The sauce is really what carries the dish - slightly sweet &amp; slightly spicy, just like I like it :) Being the new year, I exercised portion control and made 3 meals out of the 1 order.
