Actually, knowing we&#39;d be ordering cheesecake afterwards made it easier to stop eating to make room for dessert :) Win Win!<br><br>GARLIC NOODLES - $12.95<br>Also good dish. Spaghettini, fresh asparagus, shiitake mushrooms, oven-roasted tomatoes, &amp; parmesan in garlic sauce w/ chicken. Delicious sauce. <br><br>SALMON W/ MISO - $12.95<br>I had just a bite and loved the sauce. My friend got this both times.<br><br>The cheesecakes are great and like their entrees, the slices are generous. Both times my friend and I shared 1 slice which was plenty. Tried Red Velvet and the Lemon Raspberry Cream - both very good. <br><br>Service was excellent both times, and both times the server asked if wanted separate checks w/o us asking. <br><br>FYI - restaurant is part of Cumberland Mall so plenty of free parking in front.

The first thing I can say is think about going to Longhorns Steakhouse to spend your money, you probably will save money and have a lot better food. Had a party of 7, empty restaurant yet had to wait. Once seated we had a waitress that was preoccupied with everything else but us. It took her a long time to take our order, even longer to get our order (over an hour @9:00 pm).* The food was horrible*. I had the Fettuccine Alfredo with shrimp. The Fettuccine sauce tasted like a package just add water type, it was gritty, the shrimp was rubbery (overcooked). Everyone in the party had various issues with their meals as well. Everyone that had shrimp had the same rubbery overcooked issue. A major hint if you plan on visiting the Cheesecake factory, bring a cellphone with a flashlight, you will need it to read the menu or look at your food, the lighting was Horrible, even for the 17 year olds in our group. Also, bring plenty of money due to the overpriced menu, and bring patience... you will need all of the above. ***Later read reviews of air conditioning unit leaking down on people, that is probably the reason for the horrible lighting.

Dinner on Tuesday with a large group. Ordered a simple side of 3 meatballs as my entrée and after 20 minutes found out they didn&#39;t even have them. Ordered pumpkin cheesecake to again find out they didn&#39;t have the item.  Waiter told us never to come in Monday or Tuesday because they always are out of stuff.  Don&#39;t waste your time. Go somewhere else.

Out visit started out with the usual wait at this location.  When our name was called, the hostess seated 2 other parties before us and said they were putting two tables together for us (only 2 in our party). The waiter was very friendly and told us about the Happy Hour specials.  We hadn&#39;t planned on getting appetizers but thought they would be good for evening snacks later tonight since we are staying in a hotel nearby.  It took almost an hour to get the appetizers and only ate a small amount because our meals would be coming soon...or so we thought.  Our meals came after we asked several times what the problem was.  Our waiter said the kitchen was very slow tonight for some reason and he didn&#39;t know why. (his words).  When the check came, we had been charged full price for both appetizers.  We questioned the cost and we were told that the specials ended before we ordered and he was sorry if he had misled us.  The waiter said he would try to get the bill adjusted but instead the manager showed up and asked if we had a problem.  He was cordial at best and said he would make &#34;an adjustment&#34;.  We had also asked for a cheesecake (1) to go and noticed we were charged for 2 slices when we got back to our room!  Not our best visit to normally one of my favorite restaurants!!

We just walked out because after sitting at a table for 5 minutes we had yet to see a server. We&#39;ve been to this location once before and the service was fair. This time we didn&#39;t even get that far. Not sure how this restaurant stays open with their lack-luster service and overly inflated prices.

Horrible experience this past Sunday, 12/11/18 with my wife and daughter.  Arrived at 12:30pm and told 20 mins wait time...after 30 mins, asked front desk if we were close and they said another 6 remained on our &#34;wait time&#34; per the computer.  Went to the bar to wait it out...the bartender did not even so much as acknowledge me standing there, but instead stood at the wait staff area and proceeded to complain to servers about having to remake some drink.  I successfully got her attention and simply asked for a bottle of beer and 2 iced teas.  She proceeded to make other drinks, complain more to servers about other orders and finally handed me a bottle of beer 10 mins...no tea.  Waited another 10 mins....still no tea.  She says there is no iced tea behind the bar....I&#39;m thinking surely there are customers that sit at the bar and order a meal that would potentially want iced tea.  Bartender says...have to wait for a server.  ugh...enough about that.  Finally seated....takes forever for a server....drinks take 15 mins and my beer (which I presume was coming from the same bartender) was not served for another 10 mins on top.  ordered appetizers....took forever and then the chicken for the lettuce wraps was ice cold.  Ordered another beer once my meal arrived...took 30 mins to bring it out....net/net, this place has gone down hill and bad.  do yourself a favor and drive the extra 15 mins over to Perimeter.

Last night my husband and I went to have some dinner and drinks. The food was really good and my Strawberry Margarita was one of the best that I&#39;ve ever had! For our appetizer we had the Crab and Artichoke dip, it was delicious! My husband had the Herb Crusted Salmon and Steak. I enjoyed the Shrimp Scampi and Chicken Madeira. We both enjoyed our meals, but weren&#39;t able to finish them. We enjoyed our dinner, despite the hour and so wait. The wait gave us some time to do a little shoe shopping! :)

Who doesn&#39;t love the Cheesecake Factory?  Load up on appetizers and indulge on the cheesecake!  I had a vegetarian friend with me who ordered the nachos and asked for no meat - they put a chipotle sauce on it with jalapenos, cheese, onions, etc. and it was excellent.  The stuffed mushrooms had a crunch to the topping which was a wonderful surprise, and the tempura shrimp were excellent although the &#34;dynamite sauce&#34; didn&#39;t have much &#34;dynamite&#34;.  And of course the cheesecake was fabulous - my fav is the tiramisu version.  Heavenly!  This was the most expensive dinner of the three nights there, but so worth it!

My daughter and I went to The Cheesecake Factory after a long day and having missed dinner, so we were starving.  We immediately ordered some wine and dove into the incredible bread while we perused the long but wonderfully diverse menu.  We wanted to start with an appetizer but couldn&#39;t decide between the Cheeseburger Eggrolls and Fried Macaroni and Cheese, so we ordered both despite knowing that we were already headed for a &#34;to go&#34; box right out of the gate!  We both commented on how much we had already eaten, but we had come for salad and needed something resembling a vegetable, so we decided to share the Cobb Salad.  We had done so before but had forgotten how HUGE it is but were quickly reminded when it was placed before us.  We each ate a good-sized portion, and still had enough left that we took it home in two &#34;to go&#34; boxes for our lunches the next day.  However, no well-adjusted law-abiding citizen goes to The Cheesecake Factory without having cheesecake, so we got a Dulce de Leche and a White Chocolate Raspberry, also &#34;to go,&#34; and LOVED EVERY BITE when we ate them later in the evening.  Great food, great wine, fabulous service!!

This place is the ok only my server was not professional at all when asked for a glass of hot water because they sit your silverware on the bare unsanitary table after waiting an SOME of the food arrives request hot water from your sever an his reply is you must have never waited on a party of 14 NO I HAVE NOT BECAUSE INAM A BOSS but had I needed to wait on a table of 14 am I became over come my response should be my apologies this is quite a large party I will be right back with your water that would have helped the tip factor which is what waiter work for an to get those you need customer service which he lacks truly but the manager came over apologies for the many many many error that this season severs have is an she compensated the birthday girl so all is all it was not good services an the food was meh may a cute cheesecake stop spot but not good dinning

I like coming here but today it took almost 10 min before our server brought our drinks. And our appetizer never came and when the manager brought our salads out we had said we never got our appetizer and he just said I&#39;m sorry, meanwhile our server is at another table just chatting away. He finally came over and said I&#39;m sorry about the appetizer I didn&#39;t think it would take that long to make. And he never asked how our food was. It will be a long long time before we return back.

No stars.  Had dinner this evening and the food came out cold after we waited an hour to receive it.  The restrooms were disgusting. Overall, the experience certainly left a lot to be desired.  Definitely will not be returning.

Service sucks..... I went to the bar area with he tall tables waited 15 mins for service no one came. So I asked for a server. He came he sucked he seemed like he didn&#39;t want to help didn&#39;t check on us came by the table many times when it was time to pay...  I wish them luck I will not come back to this location..

Meh. <br>The wife and I haven&#39;t been here until today and I can almost guarantee we won&#39;t come back. <br>Took 10 minutes for the waiter to come ask us what we wanted to drink . OK cool that&#39;s understandable, they are sort of busy. Then 5 minutes later be comes and asks again. Then a few minutes later I overhear him asking another waitress to bring us drinks. It&#39;s not really our waiter&#39;s fault though. Management has them spread too thin. <br>I ordered a sandwich and an app then my wife got spaghetti. The spaghetti tasted like it was sponsored by Morton&#39;s salt. Like Morton himself made the sauce. Pure salt. <br>All this took about an hour and a half to get in and out. The food wasn&#39;t worth the wait or the price we paid.

Kinda late on this review lol. came here last Friday with Ryan Gorman for dinner, packed as always on the weekend, we had to wait about 25 minutes for a table, not an issue with me since the food is always worth it and the servers are always great.<br><br>We started with the Avocado Eggrolls for appetizers; I love avocados, so good with the tamarind cashew dipping sauce, literally the only kind of eggroll I actually like. For entrees Ryan and I decided to go with pasta, I ordered the Tomato Basil Pasta and Ryan ordered the Fettuccini with Chicken and Sun Dried Tomatoes, our waitress Sunshine (yes that is her actual name, cute right lol) was great, but she got the order wrong for Ryan and brought him the Chicken Fettuccini Alfredo instead, Ryan was nice enough to keep it actually and ordered some marinara sauce to compliment it, both plates were delicious and plentiful I was only able to eat half. Obviously we ordered cheesecake afterwards, Ryan got the Ultimate Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake and I got the Chocolate Mousse Cheesecake, both were mighty delicious and creamy, enjoyed them completely.<br><br>In my opinion we should have gotten a discount for getting part of the order wrong, or at least charge us the price for the sun dried tomatoes which is cheaper the fettuccini alfredo, but they charged us full price, that is the only reason I&#39;m giving four starts instead of five, other than that, we had a great experience all around.

I dined at the bar on a Sunday evening. The restaurant was busy, but there were a few spots at the bar. I was alone so I didn&#39;t mind and I wanted to eat quickly and then get on the road with a 2 Hour drive home ahead of me. One of my favorite indulgences is the sweet corn tamale cakes. They were good, but not as good as I remembered them from times past at other locations. I ate those while I sat at the bar, and ordered Thai lettuce wraps to go. They were kind enough to substitute grilled salmon for the chicken. I&#39;m fortunately, this is where things really went wrong. I waited a long time for my to go tieless wraps, which should have been a fast order to prepare. I also asked for brown bread only to go, and ended up waiting 30 minutes just for that. When I finally got up and threatened to leave without my order, they pulled it together and got it to me.

I love Cheesecake Factory. Everything cooked in lots of butter, plus cheesecake and good drinks. You can&#39;t go wrong. I&#39;ve eaten at this one plenty of times, as it&#39;s the one closest to my home. Never any service problems. Even on holidays or event days where it&#39;s packed you&#39;ll still have good service.

Decided to try again, cause I love their menu. Much better experience! Stacy was our server, she was great! Came with my hubby this time, so my Momo missed out. <br><br>A  little late, however, I needed to put them out there. <br>Prior to moving to Ga, my family and I spent some time stationed in Hawaii, with the US Navy, where we frequented the Cheesecake Factory Waikiki, often, no problems.<br>It&#39;s around 7:00 in the evening, we&#39;re hungry, and my 10 year old daughter suggests we go to the Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m all in, love their old fashioned strawberry shortcake, chicken caesar salad, amongst other things. We get there, it&#39;s not that busy, the hosts seats us, and we&#39;re looking at the menu. After waiting about 10 minutes for water, or just to be acknowledged, NOTHING, okay. <br>A woman is seated along side of us, turns to look for her other half, spots him, he sits down, and in a flash, napkins are laid on their table and they are asked how they&#39;re doing and what would they like to drink.<br>My daughter noticed the ignorance before I could even respond. Needless to say, we left and had a wonderful experience at The Grub Burger. Their entire staff needs to be re-trained in QUALITY customer service, cause those lame-O&#39;s are giving a quality restaurant a bad name!<br>Four thumbs down!!!!

I came in on a late Monday evening and ordered some water with my food and it tastes like straight ass. Like someone washed they ass in it, and served it in a cup. :) don&#39;t order water taste disgusting!

The absolute very best cheesecake ever made. You can&#39;t just get one slice, with so many varieties the choice feels impossible. With a large group of friends we each order 2 of our favorites then one slice we&#39;ll share pieces with each member. This is wonderful except you then find yourself with brand new favorites!!

Ordered a chicken pasta with chipotle sauce and no words it&#39;s just delicious. Too many options on the menu. Very friendly staff, lovable ambiance, enough space. Bread and desserts are too good. Bread gets hard in no time, had to eat as soon as it reach the table.

Thank you for reminding me why I don&#39;t make the trip to eat here! The worst service ever!! We only came to celebrate my daughters birthday and our server Chantal had a nasty attitude. Saying she had no personality and we had to wait constantly for our drinks, the bread, entree, and desert. It got to a point that we thought she was hiding out. The food is good but to have to sit through this long wait, having to chase her down just for her to take another 13 minutes for the check is absolutely ridiculous. I&#39;ve been sitting here at the table waiting for our bill while our party or 8 is buying cheesecake and she has yet to bring us the check. Oh and by the way she&#39;s taking another order at another  table, brought drinks and bread to another. Forget about coming here and enjoying a nice meal. Hire servers that want to be here that will be courteous, or at least train them in real customer service. We would probably get better service from the Golden Corral. <br><br>Again thanks for the reminder as to why it is a waste of time to come here for dinner. Next time we&#39;ll go to Mangiano&#39;s. They would tear us with respect with a server that would have a good attitude and not be bothered when we request bread, or our check. <br><br>Definitely McDonald&#39;s type of service!

Customer service is terrible.  Order a steak and you get no steak knife. The people that bring your food drop it off on your table and take off running back to the kitchen. They can not ask if you need anything else. Then you sit there waiting for your server while food gets cold. Share this with female manager and they do not care.

The Cheesecake Factory is always one of my favorite restaurants. Typically always back and a tourist and local favorite. This particular one is located/attached to the Cumberland Shopping Mall along with other restaurants. Parking is found in the lots surrounding the mall or the valet service. Every time I have came here it takes a while to find an open space; however if you are getting your food to-go there is one to two spaces to park at for 15mins to pick up your food. The wait time can rage between 15 mins and 45mins, just depends on day and time. Weekends are extremely pack and during the week not so much. The bar area is available as well for faster seating but once again it tend to be filled up. My favorite appetizer that I highly recommend is the fried macaroni and cheese balls---delicious and needed before the meal. My whole family loves them since I introduced them to it. I tend to order the shrimp and chicken gumbo paired with brown rice and maybe a daiquiri. The presentation of this dish is beautiful and the flavors and  taste just the same if not better. I highly recommend this dish and it will fill you up with leftovers to take home as well. If possible please leave room for dessert or take it to-go. I cannot visit any location without ordering one of the cheesecakes. I have personally tried and loved the following kinds: Red velvet, Original Strawberry, Chocolate lover, and Oreo. My all time favorite and pick is the red velvet. The city and area of Atlanta have so many restaurant choices when I can&#39;t decide The Cheesecake Factory is my go to place.
This isn&#39;t one of their best nights for service, cleanliness, and taste.  I&#39;m disappointed for the amount that they charge. Normally everything is good but not tonight.

I don&#39;t like having to wait 30 minutes for a waiter to take my order. On top of that for them to leave a spoon on the floor, not offer refills and leave dirty dishes on both sides of me while I eat. Just not what I expect from the Cheesecake Factory. They definitely need secret shoppers in there to get these below average wait staff up to par.

4.5 Star. <br>Cheesecake Factory (this one particularly) is a staple favorite of Mine ever since the T.G.I Friday&#39;s left Powers Ferry Road in Marietta. It&#39;s My go-to for many dinner dates and afternoons with friends. <br>A party of 2 can expect 20 minute - 1 hour wait times on a Friday or Saturday night. Valet is available on these nights, and it&#39;s recommended since parking spaces are few and far between.  The large fountain courtyard is a good place for your party to relax and chat while awaiting a table if sitting at the bar isn&#39;t of interest.<br><br>Like all Cheesecake Factory&#39;s, portions are huge, the selections are extensive, the ambiance is lively but romantic under some circumstances, and the interior decor is beautifully designed.<br>The soaring mural ceiling and large windows (which are promptly shaded upon sunset) really give the place a sense of spaciousness. There&#39;s an outdoor dining patio scattered with powerful heat lamps so diners can enjoy it even during really chilly evenings, it it also quieter than indoors.<br><br>I always seem to order the same thing, despite the vast number of items on the  menu. <br>When I have ventured to try other items, I haven&#39;t been disappointed.<br>My favorite order is the Thai Lettuce Wraps followed by a Chinese Chicken Salad. <br><br>The Thai lettuce wraps are insanely good and the portion is more than plentiful, it is a meal in itself. There are large lettuce leaves (iceberg and a purple variety?) which you fill with Satay chicken, shredded carrots, bean sprouts, and noodle strings. It is served with 3 different Thai-inspired dipping sauces, they are so delicious, I always order extras of each. Things will get messy with these wraps, but I promise that you wont even care!<br>Other favorite appetizers are the Firecracker Salmon Rolls, Avocado Eggrolls, and Buffalo Blasters - they&#39;re awesome and great to share. The Ahi Carpaccio (raw tuna with wasabi and avocado cream) is also wonderful.<br><br>The Chinese Chicken Salad mountain makes a grand entrance, it is piled high!<br>Crispy rice noodles and wontons, savory grilled chicken, mandarin orange slices, sesame seeds and other toppings grace this delicious Asian-inspired salad. The tasty Chinese plum dressing really sets it off. Yum. <br><br>Their orange chicken is pretty good too, it&#39;s not actually spicy though and I wish the sauce was heavier. Same goes for their Bang-Bang chicken &amp; shrimp and the Caramel Chicken (which I ordered sans-mushroom) entrees. <br><br>The best way to order your drinks is directly at the bar, the bar also offers the perfect diversion if you&#39;re stuck waiting for a table. They have added a &#34;Skinny Drink&#34; menu, and many other drinks can be made &#34;skinny&#34; as well. <br>On the &#34;Skinny&#34; note, I once ordered the grilled artichoke, it was surprisingly tasty. <br><br>Once you&#39;re seated, even if the place is packed and service is slower than usual, you&#39;ll be given a complimentary basket of 2 sliced bread loafs with sweet butter to accompany them. The basket will be replenished upon request.<br>I&#39;ve always received reasonably good service here, no complaints to make.<br><br>I rarely order dessert because I&#39;m already bursting at the seams and holding a to-go box by the time I&#39;m finished with My meal. However, you really can&#39;t go wrong no matter what you order! I enjoy My cake ala mode when I&#39;m able to indulge.

Checked out the factory @ Perimeter Mall (not Cumberland) last night with my 10 month old, a friend and her 4 year old. It wasn&#39;t busy but the service took a while so expect to wait a while to get seated, have a server come take your order and bring your food out.<br><br>I mainly went for the cheesecake, hadn&#39;t had one in forever but I also ordered the mango crush which was pretty good and had the crab bites-- not bad and pretty fulfilling considering that I hadn&#39;t eaten since lunch time @ work. We were there around 8:30pm<br><br>I rated an A-OK because our drinks (including the water) took FOREVER to get to us. It shouldn&#39;t take almost 30 minutes to get our drinks especially when the restaurant wasn&#39;t packed...

Cold bread and wrapper butter is not the best first impression. It took the waiter a while to serve us, and even longer for the food. The food was good whenever it came out. My drink went empty several times and it took them a while to be able to notice and fill. Good food, slow service. Also charged my friend extra when she ordered off the lunch menu. When she brought it to their attention, they didnt change it!

They do more than just cheesecake! The lettuce wraps are awesome and the cheesecake is really good too. We ate there for our anniversary and we&#39;ll be back. The biggest problem at Cumberland is the lack of parking.

Me and my brother come here all the time to get cheese cake love the food! I would recommend the banana cheese cake with extra bananas :). Also every time we come the staff is super great offering free bread and doing what they are suppose to!

Nasty employees<br><br>I&#39;ve been to CCF only a few times, this location in particular twice. We were seated within 5 minutes of arrival, but it took us a good while to actually meet our server after being seated. I also noticed that the hostesses double sat our server with the guests that were seated right before us (yes, I&#39;m in the service industry, I know how this all works), it took them a while to be greeted as well. The food was good and came out pretty quickly. Here is my real issue, I ordered the orange chicken which is a large portion of food, after eating some of it I asked for a box. Eventually our server came back and took my plate to box it in the kitchen as some restaurants do, which is fine. When he brought my food back in a container and bag, I peaked inside only to find 1/2 of my leftover chicken in the box... It was obvious my food was eaten (probably by multiple staff (it was a lot of food)). This is DISGUSTING, yes, believe it or not guests notice these things. Watch your employees, where I work you&#39;d be fired for something like that... Totally turned me off and ruined my experience.

Horrible service today. My daughter and I eat out about 5-6 times a week. Had to ask for bread which didn&#39;t come out until after the first appetizer. Ran out of cocktails sauce with our calamari and had to ask THREE times for some more cocktail sauce. The waitress just kept bringing cold tomato paste instead of cocktail sauce. My daughter even suggested to me that maybe the waitress forgot about us or went home. Had to ask for refills of our waters that were completely out. First time in a long time I contemplated not leaving the tip at all. I still left the tip even though she did not deserve one at all.<br><br>So ready to just leave didn&#39;t even order dessert.

Visited for lunch today with a few girls from work. Food was great, however it came out in such odd increments that it was really frustrating. Our server was fine, but didn&#39;t do more than the minimum requirements for getting us fed.

Worse service I ever had, just went in for apps and Cheesecake this took 2 hrs when my corn cakes they were burnt. I spoke to a manger and 15-20 later I received another one. They comped the corn cakes but charged it twice and removed one to get the waiter its forever. Then he fixed it after another 10 mins. It took forever and service and food was not what I except for a Cheesecake Factory.

I love the cheesecake factory. I mostly love the cheesecake part of it but I think the food is good too. I just wish it was a little bit less expensive especially the lunch menu. I went one day for lunch with my mom and I ordered a cobb salad, which even for the lunch portion, is still a good sized salad. I can&#39;t imagine what the dinner one looks like! If it was even smaller and cheaper I would like it a little more since I couldn&#39;t even eat half of it. The cobb salad is full of bacon, bleu cheese, shredded egg, half an avocado sliced and mixed with a vinaigrette. I like to mix ranch with vinaigrettes so I asked for a cup on the side. <br><br>The service was good. I never feel like I get great service though. This time was no different. Our server brought bread out and brought the extra dressing we asked for but never returned to see if we needed anything else until she brought the bill. Every experience at this location is always the same.

Their food is okay. I&#39;d go at lunch when it&#39;s cheaper. I only come here for the cheesecake. If you come on a holiday...don&#39;t unless you like waiting in a horrible line outside the door in Georgia&#39;s humid summers.

I simply can&#39;t stay away from TCF.  I&#39;m there for somebody&#39;s celebration or because I crave the Chicken Madeira or because I love the happy hour menu or because I need the Banana Fosters cheesecake. It&#39;s always one of those that gets me there and I am always happy when I leave.  <br><br>Whichever one I end up going to (I&#39;ve frequented all of them in the Atlanta area), service is always good, the atmosphere is nice, and I get some good grub.  I have never ordered nor tasted anything off another&#39;s plate that I didn&#39;t think was yummy.  <br><br>The Chicken Madeira is excellent and served with asparagus and mashed potatoes.  I have such a hard time getting away from it.  Also, the happy hour menu, available from 4 to 6, M-F, features some of their regular sized appetizers for only $5.  I love that!  Portions are large and the selection is awesome.  They pour some pretty good drinks too!  <br><br>Like I said, I can&#39;t stay away from TCF.

Arrived here around 4:45pm on a Sat. Was told it would be a 20 min wait. After 30-35 min of my pager not buzzing nor having my name called, I went back to the hostess and she said we were next. Another 15 mins passed and I saw that two families, that came in after us, were being seated. So again I had to go to the hostess and she said &#34;oh yeah y&#39;all were supposed to be next&#34;. So basically we had a defective pager. But soon after that we were seated- after nearly an hr wait, which was only supposed to be 20 mins. It didn&#39;t take long for our server (Tamara B) to arrive and I have no complaints about her. Actually, her service made up for us having that issue with the wait time. No complaints about the food.

Oh my gosh! I freaking love this place! The menu is HUGE and I never know what to order but whatever I pick ends up being delicious! <br>My favorite fish so far is the chicken de pana. Mmmmmm heck yes! <br>Also, the cheese cakes are to die for! Favorites include, Oreo cheescake, the original (of course), and the kahlua. They also have a tiramisu cheescake I want to try the next time I go, which will be soon! <br>And the servers are so nice! Fresh bread was brought out almost immediately!

I had the steak quesadilla and it was ok. The steak was a little tough, next time I&#39;ll stick with the chicken. Their macaroni and cheese balls are very good. The Cosmo&#39;s were ok, could of been a little bit stronger to hit the spot. Overall ok, but server was attentive.
Do not order carry out. They are so incompetent. They said pick up in 30 minutes while in reality it was an hour. Waited 30 minutes after waiting in line after paying. Sad!!!

First of all we had to wait forever. I understand it&#39;s a Saturday but dang it&#39;s ridiculous. They tried to put me and 4 of my other muscular friends at a 4 people booth. Our food took forever and it was just a crazy experience.

Ahh the chain restaurant. Same name, different service. The Cumberland Mall location is less than appealing. Nothing to write home to Mama about just a restaurant with a familiar name.<br><br>My first sense of displeasure was with the waitstaff. A few of them were gathered behind me complaining and  very loudly. Not sure if it was personal or business but it was definitely inappropriate. Secondly my waiter, Samuel, his whole demeanor was off. We went back and forth on whether or not they had a Happy Hour menu. He was adament that they didn&#39;t and then 2 minutes later provided me with a &#34;special&#34; Bar menu where all most appetizers were $5 during 4 - 7...hmmm sounds like happy hour to me. As I waited for my friend, I noted how empty it was.  Normally The Cheescake Factory is always crowded but then again that&#39;s usually the Perimeter location. <br><br>Overall, the visit was fair, even though Samuel decided to argue yet again. This time about the ingredients in a Hot Toddy.  I stand by the fact that alcohol should,  in fact be included. I returned the drink, we paid our tab and left knowing the Cumberland location would not get another dime out of us. <br><br>Too bad. I loved the 1530 calorie Fried Mac &#39;n Cheese.

Went there for lunch today. I ordered Sheila&#39;s Chicken &amp; Avocado Salad, but I aaked for peanuts instead of the standard cashews. Well, I didn&#39;t get peanuts or cashews...I got pecans. And there was no avocado at all which is a complete brainteaser considering the word &#34;avocado&#34; is in the name of the dish on the menu. <br><br>Also, I&#39;m not sure which restaurant can lay claim to being the first but this salad is very, very similar to the Thai Chicken Salad at J. Alexander&#39;s...the chicken is even sliced in the same super-thin, length-wise manner. And considering the one at J.Alexander&#39;s is far superior to this salad in just about every way (flavor, texture, value, etc.), this salad felt like a knockoff. <br><br>The avocado misstep normally wouldn&#39;t deserve one less star but since it&#39;s in the name of the dish itself I couldn&#39;t look past it. Not remembering the peanut switch request also wouldn&#39;t normally be such a bad thing but I got neither what is normally on the dish (cashews) nor what I asked for (peanuts). Therefore, that was worth an entire star, too. Two big mistakes on the same day made me miss the J.Alexander&#39;s version even more. It&#39;s never good when a dish reminds you of a competing restaurant. So that had to be worth a star too. <br><br>Add it up, and it was a 2-star experience.
at the Cheesecake Factory on May 25th in the evening the wait was a little long the service was good but the food was a little blan and the drinks were watered down the Ambiance is wonderful

I&#39;d give it a &#34;meh&#34; out of 10. This was my first time and we went because I had a gift card. The &#34;fire roasted artichoke&#34; that we started with seemed like it was steamed instead of roasted because it came out really soggy and unappealing. Not really enhanced by either sauce it came out with either. <br><br>After our appetizer it took and exceptionally long time to get our main course. Without us asking about it a manager came out to explain that the kitchen forgot to cook the salmon for my girlfriend&#39;s salad which was causing the delay. So by the time the food actually came out mine (chicken and broccoli) volcanically hot and dried out from being reheated. <br><br>Our server was nice and apologetic about the wait on the food, but overall I don&#39;t have any strong desire to head back to Cheesecake Factory.

Four of us dined at the Atlanta location last night.  The service was slow but the food was great.  There is a huge menu so I suggest skipping appetizers because the entrees are large portions!  We enjoyed the Herb Crusted Salmon, Southern Fried Catfish, Chicken Piccatta and Four Cheese Pasta with Chicken.  Unfortunately, the waitress forgot my friend&#39;s salad, but she did take it off the meal.  If you are in a hurry, skip this restaurant or at least this location.  For a Tuesday night, it was moderately busy, but certainly not packed and the meal took about two hours.<br><br>Save room for dessert!

Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite places to eat. Everything I&#39;ve had on the menu has been delicious. This time I decided to try the Fish &#39;N Chips on the lunch menu. It was fried perfectly, with a light, crisp batter, and with crisp chips. It was perfect with malt vinegar. <br>Of course I can&#39;t forget about the Cheese Cake! This time I tried the classic Vanilla Bean. Which has a layer of vanilla mousse, it was heaven on my plate.<br>There are so many choices that it took me half of lunch to make of my mind which cheese cake to order. <br>I have to say that the cheese cake brings me back everytime!

Great service got in without a wait.... And they were quite busy.   Food was excellent servers were wonderful.   Will definitely be back again.   Cheesecake is to die for.  Chicken maderIa is my favorite dish although their steaks are great too.

Waited about an hour and a half for a table but it was soooo worth the wait. Our server was very nice. The table was awful and cramped but the food was amazing!!! And the cheesecake oh my, I could love off of it. Can&#39;t wait to go back, just not on a wekeed night.

Food was ok. Service was excellent.  Waited a while for the Food to come out. It was my friends BIRTHDAY and the staff treated her like a rockstar. A great time was had by all and it is beautiful inside!!
Delicious egg benedict. I only wish that they didn&#39;t put too much hollandaise over my eggs.<br>And of course delicious cheese cakes.
Food was decent (not as good as I remember) and waitress was very sweet, however service was a little slow.

I have usually had good experiences here, however tonight was not that night.  My family arrived for dinner around 5:15.  Service was okay for the crowd, however once we got our order in it took close to 30 min for the food to arrive.  This normally doesn&#39;t work when you have twin 6 year old boys who aren&#39;t very patient.<br><br>So, the food arrives and the boys food is piping hot.  Luckily they didn&#39;t burn themselves.  My factory burger however is ice cold.  I should have just ate it and  kept my mouth shut,  but I saw the waiter and he said he would take care of it.  But, then he comes back and says they have to make a new one which will take 5 -10 min to make.<br><br>After waiting close to 20 minutes, my family is done with their meal and they bring the cheeseburger out.  At this point, my appetite didn&#39;t want it any more or even desert. The server asks if I want to box it up and I decline.<br><br>I explained this to the waiter and we ask for a piece of cheesecake for our boys.  He asks again if I want the cheeseburger to take home.  I decline again and ask that the manager stop by.<br><br>We get the bill and my burger, drink, and the piece of cake are not on the bill.<br><br>The manger comes by and apologizes again  and offers me the cheeseburger again to take home.  Like these cheeseburger is the greatest thing since sliced bread.  Honestly,  when I came I was just looking forward to some cake but I didn&#39;t want to give them the satisfaction of spending one dime here ever again.<br><br>Now,  I wasn&#39;t expecting the entire meal to be free,  but they could have at least offered me a free desert or a free future meal.<br><br>While leaving,  my final thoughts are they really don&#39;t care about future business or understand what good customer service is.

I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory a few times for lunch with my coworkers.  While it&#39;s one of the last places I&#39;d probably choose for lunch, the food and service I&#39;ve experienced at this location has always been good.  This Cheesecake Factory is located outside of Cumberland Mall.  There&#39;s plenty of parking outside with a handful of spots reserved for curbside to-go customers.  Unlike the Buckhead location, you can call an order into the Cumberland location and have it brought out to you in the parking lot.<br><br>You can get &#34;lunch-sized&#34; portions of most of the pasta dishes until 5pm.  I put lunch-sized in quotes because the portions are still quite big.  Some of the entrees I&#39;ve eaten here include the pasta carbonara with chicken and the farfalle (bow-tie pasta) with chicken and roasted garlic.  The pasta carbonara is a basic spaghetti dish with bacon, green peas, and a garlic-Parmesan cream sauce.  It&#39;s simple, but pretty appetizing.  The farfalle isn&#39;t bad either and includes mushroom, tomatoes, pancetta, and caramelized onions.  The sauces for their pastas are generally rich and creamy.<br><br>The cheesecakes are downright delicious.  I&#39;ve tried the chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecake, the fresh banana cream cheesecake, and the Snickers bar chunks and cheesecake.  I can&#39;t say I like any one over the others as they are all very good.  The chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecake has walnuts inside.  The Snickers bar cheesecake has chunks of Snickers baked inside and is topped with hot fudge and caramel.  Delicious.<br><br>Lunch crowds during the work week can vary.  Service is typically on point and separating checks between several people (4+) has never been a problem.

You already know what this is... but it&#39;s good and the steaks aren&#39;t bed either... try the chicken wraps and usually the soups are great too. Burgers decent and I usually get the rib-eye. Good place to get smashed although I dont drink.

Finally treated myself to a lil CF. Horrible experience, 25 minute wait for a burger to come to the table. Burger was under cooked. Sent it back only to have a dry charred burger come to the table.  So they comped, but the cheesecake finesse is gone.

Really bad service. Lunch time on a busy area and it took us almost an hour to get our meals and another 30minutes for the dessert which we ended up canceling. This is on a Tuesday and the restaurant was pretty empty. I do not recommend this location. The server never apologized for all the delay and handed us the bill without acknowledging anything.

Cheesecake Factory is usually a fun experience with over 300 menu items to choose from and great desserts to try after dinner. However, our experience at the Cheesecake Factory was a disappointing to say the least. The waitress seriously needed to be fired. If I had a dollar for every item that she forgot while she was serving our food, we would have gotten a free meal. When we finally got our food, we were satisfied but it took such a long for the waitress to bring the food out. I also ordered cheesecake as well and I think the waitress mixed up the cheesecake order but we were were so exhausted after complaining so much that we kept whatever she brought us. <br><br>In terms of our food, I ordered a spicy chicken sandwich and it came with fries. I loved the sandwich and would order it again. As I mentioned earlier, the food was good but the service was AWFUL!!! Perhaps if we had a different waiter/waitress, we would have had a better experience.

I&#39;ve only been here to do takeout, haha, because I was lazy. Like, so lazy, I did their curbside to go because I didn&#39;t want to get out in my pajama pants. So I appreciate the fact that the waitress was efficient and even complimented me that I looked great. I tipped her well.<br><br>I ordered just a few things:<br><br>Ahi Tuna Salad: Still really consistent at every Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to. They keep the tuna chilled, make sure there&#39;s lots of fresh greens, and there&#39;s more than enough dressing. <br><br>Mushroom Flatbread: Not impressed. The portion is good for one person, but it didn&#39;t look appetizing with its shape. The taste was ok though, but I probably wouldn&#39;t order it or any other flatbreads again.<br><br>Chicken Samosas: The sauces with the samosas are delicious. The samosas themselves were flavorful and a little too salty for my taste. Then again, I did just order samosas from a chain restaurant that doesn&#39;t specialize in Indian cuisine, so I blame myself for that one. I was just too ashamed to order something like southwest eggrolls.<br><br>So Cheesecake Factory is still a good ol standard to eat that&#39;s a step-up from the other fast foods. I definitely appreciate the ease of calling in my order and picking it up especially when it&#39;s close by.
Service was extremely slow, food was ok not the best. Can&#39;t say I had a good experience.  The waitress seemed like she was hesitant to take on our party. Won&#39;t be back to this location.

The worst experience ever! Loved our waitress Dede and proactive Landon (he got our order fixed). <br>Our bread was old and cold.<br>Our Chicken Costelleto was cold...the chicken...the asparagus...and the sauce. The only thing hot was the mashed potatoes.<br>The manager said the sauce was supposed to be room temp.<br>No sir...bullcrap! We asked our waitress to make sure our sauce was hot. It still came out cold!!! The kitchen at this location is a constant disappointment and I say Im going to give it another try. NEVER AGAIN! Sad that management wants to use the excuse that the sauce is supposed to be room temp. What a bunch of crap!! Obviously the manager has better things to do then care about his customer base.<br>YOU ARE A HORRIBLE MANAGER AND SHOULD GO BACK TO CORPORATE TRAINING...IF YOU WENT IN THE FIRSY PLACE.

This is my favorite place to eat but there&#39;s never been one near me so we always have to drive pretty far to get to one. My sister in law is in town so we decided to drive over and the experience was mostly terrible. The food took forever, they got our order wrong, we ordered the Chicken Romano and it had the wrong sauce on it so they offered to replace it, which was nice but it took another 25 minutes for them to replace our food and the manager was extremely rude about it. The ONLY saving grace for this particular Cheesecake was our waitress Leni Andro, she was amazing!! She was apologetic, very sweet, and she personally paid for a mistake the kitchen made at another table, out of her own pocket. This girl loves her job and Cheesecake is lucky to have her, especially this branch! She could teach the manager a thing or two.

I have visited this Cheesecake Factory several times since my first review, so I think it&#39;s time for an update.  I think the food has definitely gotten better over the years, and the Cheesecake Factory is one of those places that has something for everyone.  It is the perfect gathering place for lunch or dinner.  I stopped in last week and ordered lunch with a friend.  My server was wonderful, and even though we caught the lunch crowd, our food came out in a reasonable amount of time.  I ordered the mushroom burger with fries and it was delicious!  I definitely keep coming back to this place time and time again!
Won&#39;t be back. Seated immediately then ignored for 20 minutes. Tons of servers and a light late lunch crowd.

wow...  So we all know the cheesecake is to die for...  and maybe I shouldn&#39;t complain about their savory side. that being said.. I&#39;ll proceed with honesty. <br><br>I kept it simple with a Margherita pizza. sounds like it would be a tough one to mess up but nevertheless..  it arrived with sparingly used marinara,  no tomatoes and no basil... ??!  really?  They added basil...  the pizza was 13 on the menu.. meh. <br><br>As for the 7 year old, my son,  he played it safe with buffalo strips and fries..  no complaints really but not elevated or anything.  8 bucks on the children&#39;s menu. <br><br>My lovely wife created her own omelet. Cheddar, roasted peppers, jalapeño, and diced ham. Omelet seriously lacked cheese..  enough to make her dig for it..  toast with no butter or fancy organic jam {what was the purpose} and served with seasoned potatoes which were pretty good but it&#39;s potatoes. <br><br>overall...  way overated ..  eat anywhere else more affordable nearby and just scoop up a piece of pie on the way home.

The food is not that good. We had 11 people in our group and 7 of our dishes were under cooked or tasted bland. When approaching management the problem was still not solved and for the price it is definitely a place to skip.

This has become my new go to place for salad. Such LARGE portions. A great value. Also love chicken Madera!  My favorite cheesecake is raspberry with white chocolate. Wish the prices were a little lower but would hate for the quality of food to suffer. Always excellent staff!
The best one in Atlanta very clean good fresh food don&#39;t go to perimerter mall it&#39;s dirty and bad service no comparison Cumberland is the best we eat out quite a lot hope it stays good

The Cheesecake Factory is always delicious; I have yet to visit a location that does not provide incredible food. The atmosphere is delightful, and the interior decor is beautiful. This was our first visit to the Cheesecake Factory at the Cumberland Mall. They conveniently have valet parking out front (only $3 before 3pm!) Our server, however, was less than pleasant. He acted annoyed to be serving us. He said no more than 5 words and never looked at us. He would come by quickly, slamming things around on the table, and spilling drinks from pitchers as he refilled our glasses. The restaurant was not busy at all; we dined at 2pm on a Tuesday.

We Came here on Sunday for lunch while visiting the Atlanta area. Well... Let&#39;s say I wondered why this restaurant didn&#39;t get the best reviews and now I know why. Our waiter was a guy named Terry who was extremely rude and made the entire table feel as though we were annoying him!! We will never go here again

This was phenomenal! We&#39;ve always wanted to go to a Cheesecake Factory. (Cheesecake is my hubby&#39;s fave dessert.) we have lunch on Saturday and it took a while to get a table, but the food and service was A+. Hubs got the Chicken Bellagio which was the best, and my pasta (with sun dried tomato sauce) was ok. Do to necessarily recommend that exact dish. Also, he had the fabulous red velvet came cheesecake and I had the banana cheesecake. They were both awesome!! And hue slices!! We loved it and hope to be back!

I have never felt compelled to write about my experiences at Cheesecake factory but this time is an exception. And not a good exception. I understood that National Cheesecake Day would understandably be a busy day and I expected a long wait to be seated. That part wasn&#39;t as bad as I thought. I was quoted an accurate wait time.<br><br>The bad part was our service. I cannot think of the young man&#39;s name that waited on us . That&#39;s how crappy our service was. When we were seated he did come immediately to the table and took our drink order. We only ordered water and coke zero. That took 10 minutes in itself. My grandma said he must have placed us on a low priority since we didn&#39;t order expensive drinks. When he did come back to our table he did have bread with him which was a plus so I figured he would be very efficient. I thought wrong.<br> Once our order was taken we never received anymore bread, was never asked if we wanted anymore. I was lucky to get a refill on my water. The expeditor brought out our food. Our waiter almost passed our table before he realized the food was there to ask if we needed anything else. After that, he didn&#39;t come back to the table within a span on 20 minutes to ask if our food was okay or even to ask if we wanted to go on and order our cheesecake. I grew so irritated I just got up and ordered my cheesecake from the takeout line.<br><br>I have worked food service before in every level imaginable, from hostess to manager. So I always try to give the benefit of the doubt on an exceptionally busy day. But when it seems like our table was a second thought to our waiter, that&#39;s a whole another thing.<br><br>This location is so inconsistent. I&#39;ve either had excellent service here or crappy service. Never a happy medium.<br><br>#Yelp100
It would be nice not to have to wait 20minutes before our waiter came to get our drink order.

This location has always been a great place to eat. My party was actually wanting to go to P.F. Chang&#39;s next door, but due to their lack of accommodation, the wait was way too long. We checked next door and The Cheesecake Factory was able to take a party of 8 immediately, no wait. Surprising for a Friday night as well. Our sever was great and very attentive, and diligent. Everyone&#39;s meal came out at the same time, so you didn&#39;t have that awkward pause of, should I eat or should I wait?. It was a delicious end to a great night.

ABSOLUTELY  WORST SERVICE EVER. My boyfriend and I went there for lunch during our 1-hour lunch break. we waited for 15mins to be seated when there are plenty of tables available. Ordered our food and took them 30 mins to get the food out. Got our food to go didn&#39;t even get to eat our food. A Manager came over apologized and didn&#39;t even do anything about it. Why do I want your apologize when you are not gonna compensate us? Will not EVER go there. I threw away the food it tasted disgusting after I took one bite.

We arrived a few minutes after opening. The hostess was too busy talking to a fellow employee about personal business. So  we waited and waited and we were finally seated. We arrived before the lunch crowd hit.<br>Our waiter Dwain was awesome no complaining there! I  ordered the Roadside Sliders as always with the fries. Always amazing but this time one side of the burgers were burnt. The topside was perfect. I will be taking a break from the Cheesecake Factory! I felt like we were treated rudely by the hostess and my sliders forgotten. First bad experience! :(
Great food. Great service. Bring a credit card

I had the most disappointing time at this location. This past Friday the whole buildings electricity went out for some reason &amp; where we&#39;re left to eat dinner in the dark. I know different things can happen, but there was no communication about what was going on or anything. We were told after 15 minutes that the cooks couldn&#39;t cook anything &amp; the drink machines wouldn&#39;t work either. I had no clue about how long it would last so I asked to close my check out. The waitress was gone for another 20 minutes, before I asked to speak to a manager &amp; the manager finally brought me my handwritten check. Very horrible customer service that there were no apologies or mention of maybe a comp on our next meal or anything. I will not be going back.

The food is fabulous as always! The wait time wasn&#39;t that bad for such a busy restaurant. My only complaint is that the servers seemed a little overwhelmed, like they had too many customers to wait on.

When I come here for dinner, I am very underwhelmed.  The food here is just okay, especially considering the wait it long and the parking is a pain.<br><br> The cheesecake however is divine. I have had many of the flavors, and they are extremely delicious. <br><br>The only one I do not like is the chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecake. The cookie dough is very hard and cheesecake has walnuts in it.

A rude potential customer jumped in front of the line just to get on the waiting list. And the hostess accepted her rude behavior. Although we still have a 75-90 minute wait, we walked to a nearby restaurant, was given a 45 minute wait, actually waited less than 20 minutes. Very disappointed in The Cheesecake Factory.
I&#39;ve been a fan for a long time..the food has gotten a lot better and.. very good.. a fan for life

First of all, pointing out the obvious...this place is a corporate CHAIN restaurant.  I typically avoid dining at this type of establishment, but opted to eat there anyway because it was convenient on this particular day.  Sat at the bar with a friend.  Service was slow and unfriendly.  The menu has WAY too much going on.  It took us at least 20 minutes to get through the menus and make a decision.  The bartender offered bread, and we accepted.  It wasn&#39;t complimentary, and they should let people know.  There was a charge for $2.95 for bread service on our bill.  My friend took her left overs to go and wanted to put the bread we hadn&#39;t eaten in her to-go box, but the bartender threw it away before she had the chance.  Disappointing, considering it was something we paid for.  <br><br>Won&#39;t go back.  I knew better in the first place.

I really hate doing this but the experience we had at dinner the other night was extremely bad.<br><br>To start off I work in the service industry and have for over 10 years... ( this may be my problem, I just want the same treatment I give to others)<br><br>Anyways, I called to make reservations for a Tuesday evening at 8pm for 14 people, it was the gathering after my new husband and I tied the knot. We areived at 7 and had a cocktail then I got notified that our 14 was now 16. I went to let the host know at 7:30 that it was going to be 16..in which I was told &#34;well we will see what we can do&#34; ok, no prob.<br><br>Here comes 8:45 with no word on the table, when asked we were told since we added two more people it will take longer. Ridiculous.  We then asked to speak to a manager and let him know the situation and he, again, told us the extra two people are what screwed everything up.<br><br>Longer story short... we get seated at 9. We had a waiter and waitress. Isabella and a swrver who will remain nameless..<br><br>The only reason this post gets 2 stars is because isabella was incredibly sweet, polite and personable... the manager also took care of our apps which was amazing!<br><br>The male server on the other hand should probably go try to find another job that does not include dealing in customer service. I have NEVER been out to dinner before and been waited on by someone so uninterested in their tables. I really hope his night got better. Not tobmention the amount of items that were forgotten was not acceptable. .at all.<br><br>To end the long service we didn&#39;t leave the restaurant until 11:30. And nobody got dessert to eat there. <br>All in all....I hated writing this but sometimes situations like this need to be seen.

It was a Tuesday, though there were other people in the restaurant it wasn&#39;t very busy. There wasn&#39;t a wait, and we were seated promptly. Now the bad. I had to wait over 15 minutes for a lemonade. It was over an hour before any of us were served anything to eat other than bread. The dinner order came separately and about 20 minutes apart. My wife sent her meal back, my meal didn&#39;t taste anything like how I remembered it, my son didn&#39;t like his burger (mine and my son&#39;s meal took the longest time), and my daughter&#39;s dinner was cold.  The easier was nice, and I don&#39;t believe that the issues were his fault, and he brought the manager over without us promoting him to. The manager did comp us 4 cheesecakes which was nice, better service would have been better though. It appears that the cheesecake factory in this area suffers from lazy kitchen staff and lazy food runners. That also speaks to poor management. I will not be visiting cheesecake factory again, it just isn&#39;t worth it!
My family visits this location a lot. Usually lovely just expect a long wait  on weekends (no reservations)!
Great service and accommodating for larger parties.  Very good food too.  Definitely recommend.

This location at the Cumberland Mall is usually so busy, but this particular Saturday we beat the crowd and was seated in approximately 15 minutes. The bread they served was blah. Not warm and kind of hard. I ordered the grill steal medallions. OMG it was so tasty for a &#34;skinny&#34; meal! It&#39;s not a lot but it may be perfectly portion sized but big girls need more. I was surprisingly fulfilled by the portion size though. The steak is served with asparagus, cherry tomatoes, and mashed potatoes. Sooooo good! My daughter ordered the Cajun jambalaya pasta. Can you say spicy! Yikes! But she enjoyed. The waiter was friendly and attentive. All and all it was a cool relaxing experience and I&#39;ll be back when I&#39;m on that side of town.

Had late lunch/early dinner here with family and friends on 12/20/15. This was actually my first time at this location, but my kids had been before. I had the Chicken Parmesan Sandwich, which wasn&#39;t bad, but wasn&#39;t great, but overall, I enjoyed the experience. I did enjoy my after food cocktail the Modern Old Fashioned. I&#39;ll definitely consider going to this location again.
I went with my family for my little cousin graduation from college. The food was so good. I think the chefs there cook with that southern love!!!

Our family decided to meet here at TCF outside of Cumberland Mall this past Sunday for lunch at noon. I had called earlier on the phone but they do not take reservations even if you are a party of  8. Upon arrival, I had to to circle around several times at the parking lot as it was very crowded. Plus the Christmas season around the corner did not help either. There are a few empty spots reserved for call-in-take-out orders where the staff will bring your meals to you at the assigned parking spots. That is always a plus if you don&#39;t have time to sit down.<br><br>We are a party of 8 and we were seated pretty quickly at noon. It was a big surprise to me as I expected a long wait. Maybe I had been to TCF at  Buckhead way too long.  So I was very happy to find our seats right away. The waiter came to get our drink orders and later came with 2 baskets of bread. There were 2 different kinds of bread that came with the butter slices. For appetizers, we had Margherita Fresh Baked Flatbread. It had Mozzarella, tomato and sprinkled basil on it. The other Flatbread we had was the Wild Mushrooms Flatbread. It was filled with mushrooms, garlic, shallots and fresh herbs. Very yummy.<br><br>For my main entree, I had the lunch size Luau Salad. It had slices of grilled chicken breast buried with mixed greens, cucumbers, onions, red &amp; yellow peppers, carrots and crisp wontons with some nuts, all tossed in a light vinaigrette. I was hungry and cleaned my plate. My hubby had the Caesar Salad. It was the normal lettuce with croutons, Parmesan cheese and Caesar dressing. It was alright for him but no wow factor attached. My brother-in-law had Sausage and Broccolini Pasta as his entree. It had everything a guy would want - Italian sausage, tomato, fresh Broccolini, spinach and asparagus tossed with Penne pasta and Parmesan cheese. Yum!  It must be delicious because my BIL had a fairly clean plate at the end. My SIL had the Crab Hash from the Sunday Brunch menu. It had poached eggs and Hollandaise sauce on top of sauteed crab meat, red and yellow peppers, onions and potatoes. Please check out my pictures for a better idea. She said she enjoyed every bite of it. I am now hungry thinking of her meal as it is breakfast time now. <br><br>Of course I had to save room for my Cheesecake dessert. I had the Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Cheesecake. It was a little too rich for me and I had to take it home with me. However, I did get a bite of my hubby&#39;s Dulce de Leche Caramel Cheesecake. It was moist and delicious. The Caramel Mousse did it for me. My SIL had the Ultimate Red Velvet Cheesecake. The layered cream cheese in between was so good. Of course, I had to get a bite of that too. Overall, everyone had a nice dining experience including the kids. The waiter did come back twice to check on us. He had to adjust my tab since he charged me for an extra cup of hot tea which I did not order. No problem after the adjustment. Food was good, nice atmosphere and ambiance, attentive waiter and cheesecake is always calling my name. So I am coming back! <br><br>Yelp 27/365

The food is good, this place seems more of a tourist  restaurant,  there are many restaurants that the meal are better,  but the sweet are 1000. Cheesecake Galore. The service is ok if u are dining in, a bit rushed ordering take out

The Cumberland location is beautifully decorated in a Roman Fantasy motif with Art Deco accents.  My recent visit was on a beautiful day, so we had lunch on their covered patio, which is cooled by overhead fans just in case there are no summer breezes available.<br>     Our server, Brandi, was not &#34;bubbly&#34;, but when engaged, was genuine, amiable and knowledgeable about the menu.  She showed up with drink refills without being asked, and checked on us several times during the meal to make sure we were enjoying our food and didn&#39;t need anything.<br>     As I am trying to lose weight, I ordered from their reduced calorie &#34;Skinnylicous&#34; menu (under 560 calories).  I had the Tuscan chicken, which is incredibly delicious for a &#34;healthy choice&#34; option. The oven roasted Roma tomatoes are amazing, and the pesto sauce is so good I couldn&#39;t resist dipping my bread in it to savor every drop.   If the other &#34;skinnylicious&#34; entrees are similar to the Tuscan chicken, you will definitely leave with happy tastebuds, a full belly and feeling indulgent.

Came here and ordered curbside-to-go, where you park and call the number on the sign and then they bring the food to you. Called the number on the sign and the phone rang for a few min with no one answering. We then called the restaurant and they told us they would transfer the call to curbside-to-go. Once again the phone just rang for about 5 min with no one picking up. Eventually just had to go inside even though I was wearing shorts and flip flops and it was cold out so wasn&#39;t expecting to get out of the car. In addition the estimated time for food to be ready was 20 min and while that is an estimate so it&#39;s fine to be a little longer, our food wasn&#39;t ready when we arrived and ended up taking about an hour. The restaurant was not that busy so I am not sure why it took so long. When we opened the food at home the food was cold, so I am not sure why we waited so long. In addition we weren&#39;t given any utensils or napkins despite selecting it in our order. We also did not get any bread even though it was supposed to come with the order.

Warning: I&#39;m a little opinionated in this review. If you&#39;re a fan of CF, please don&#39;t be offended. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is one of those unoriginal first date places; classy and safe, but overdone (in my book).  That being said, it serves as a wonderful &#34;date place&#34;. You know, once you two get to know each other, find out it works, and have finally gotten comfortable together.<br><br>I recently &#34;secret shopped&#34; the Cheesecake Factory near Cumberland Mall. Little would they suspect the two girls in their upper 20&#39;s would be &#34;shopping them&#34;. Anyway, the point of mentioning &#34;secret shopped&#34; is to note that I paid close attention to detail. <br><br>We walked in the door, up to the host stand, and waited for her to get off the phone. I&#39;m fairly certain it was not a personal call but we did wait a minute. <br><br>We were sat and Eli, her 1 year old, got a high chair. We fiddled with Eli for a bit. after 5minutes had passed my friend and I realized it was happening all over again. We were forgotten!!! No drinks, no water, no nada! Ugh. After looking around a bit and just a little bewildered, Alex came to our table. He took our drink order and informed us he was not our server, Renee will be right out. (Suuuure.)<br><br>However, after that little episode, lunch/dinner turned out to be superb. We split a lunch size fettucini with sun-dried tomatoes . (Renee warned us some people find the pasta to be bland. It is a hit or miss dish. It was a hit dish with us, but we both love sun-dried tomatoes.) The guacamole appetizer was TO DIE for. Yum!  <br><br>Of course, since we were at the Cheesecake Factory, we had to have cheesecake. I have four words for you:  &#34;White Chocolate Raspberry Cheesecake&#34; Heaven!<br><br>Overall, don&#39;t come here between 3:00pm to dinner hours. The servers aren&#39;t as attentive. However, Alex gets props (we&#39;re requesting him next time we come) and the food is delicious. If you like a quieter Cheesecake Factory and don&#39;t mind having a little longer wait time at your seats, this is a good time to come. <br><br>Additionally, I didn&#39;t notice their Health Code Score...so I can&#39;t report on that. Sorry!<br><br>Yumminess!!! I&#39;ll come back on a fourth date.

I love Cheesecake Factory. When I come to this Cheesecake Factory it&#39;s hardly ever a bad wait, and the food is never bad. Sometimes there can be a bad server but most of the time that isn&#39;t a problem. Every time I go to Cheesecake Factory I have to get the Fresh Strawberry Cheesecake it&#39;s my favorite.

The stars are for the food and other employees. I had the Steak Diane and Herb Crusted Salmon. My server did not refill drinks, prebus my table(A 2seater table gets crowded pretty fast with used dishes) or showed face when I needed anything. She passed my table several times but her primary concern was all the other guests. I personally didn&#39;t think she deserved a tip. Tips are earned based on service. She didn&#39;t really serve us. However, she still got 10%. Luckily her fellow servers filled our drinks and brought our order out. That&#39;s the only thing to save this review.

After 9 days on the road, driving cross country from AZ to GA, we arrived at our hotel on my birthday. :) After getting settled in, we thought Cheesecake Factory sounded awesome. Since this location is close by our hotel, we head over at about 5pm. With 2 young children in tow, we always try to beat the crowd and make breakfast, lunch and dinner just a little earlier when eating out. <br><br>We got there slightly past 5pm, was seated immediately with no wait. I told the hostess to put us in a booth or table, preferable away from everyone else, as my 2.5yo can be quite &#34;distracting&#34; and likes to play with others who seats around us. I mean, it can be cute when a 2.5yo plays peek-a-boo with you from behind a booth. But after about 5 mins or so, it gets bored quickly... ;p<br><br>We were seated at a booth along the glass windows next to their patio seatings. It was perfect! I think we were the only table there at that moment, but our server came quickly to take our drink orders. Warm bread were brought to the table shortly after, drinks, and then dinner is served. <br><br>I ordered the shrimp and sausage with pasta. It is in a red sauce with a little spice to it from the sausages. Wish there were more shrimps in the dish though, but it was pretty good. Leftover was even better the next day. <br><br>hubby ordered chicken Alfredo, the sauce was rich and creamy. Leftover for this dish, however, was not that great the next day because there were not enough Alfredo sauce in the togo box. Think our server might have missed some sauce when she packed up our leftover.<br><br>The kids ordered from their kids&#39; menu -- pizza and chicken quesadilla. They were amazing!! Portion was quite big, but we don&#39;t really mind as we adults were eating of the kids&#39; plates. ha! And yes, there were leftover from these too. And they were great the next day.<br><br>And we can&#39;t leave without having some dessert. I got the oreo cheesecake, and the boys shared something with a lot of chocolate on it. And the waitstaff sang happy birthday to me. I can tell that aside from our server, who was GREAT and AWESOME, the other 2 staff members were not too excited about singing me my birthday song. They sang with minimal expression on their face and left immediately after the last note. Well.... I was not expecting it, so I was not too disappointed by it either. :) Our server was great though. I wish I remember her name. She is petite, in her 20s, African American, with a great smile!<br><br>Service was great, our server was great. We would definitely come back to this location.

I have been having food from cheese cake factory for past 6 years. I have tried nearly all cheese cake factory restaurants in Chicago and a couple in New York . Unfortunately this restaurant was the worst among all. Their sides were so small. Their branches in Chicago always give big sides buy over here I paid 21$ for a combination deal and got 3 pieces of shrimps fully covered with tomatoes and 3 tiny pieces of steak . Where in Chicago same dish consists of 6 pieces of steak and 6 pieces of shrimps . Seats were uncomfortable to. Well it was just a one day visit to Atlanta so no more worries

It shouldn&#39;t take 30 minutes for 1 slice of cheesecake to go. We saw multiple ppl order after us... and only to get theirs before ours and once we informed the cashier of our issue, she didn&#39;t even apologize or acknowledge they lost our slip. I will not return and purposely drive further to avoid this one. Rude and horrible service.

I do not think this place will ever be more than average to me. This was one of the last places open near my house late at night. I came in and got immediate service at the bar. I ordered the dynamite shrimp and fish tacos. The shrimp was great. The tacos were horrible. The tortillas tasted like gritty paper. The fish was ok.

I will start by saying that I usually love the Cheesecake Factory. But this location is very dissapointing. When we first got there, they greeted us just fine but when we got to the booth that we were supposes to seat at the hostess all of a sudden said that she had to check because they had told her that it might be taken. So, we stood there while she went back to the hostess desk to check and then she moved us to another table. Our server; well, we never learned his name. He never provided it. The drinks took forever and it was only water and one margarita. The plate that they brought my 3 yr old&#39;s pizza in was SO hot that the runner felt bad and went back to get another plate to switch the pizza. They didn&#39;t have any kind of crayons or anything for kids. The food itself was bland. I was looking forward to a great experience and I left feeling completel underwhelmed.

Service is so so. Took over 15 minutes even for kids lemonade cause the bartender broke some glass and they had to tend to that. Finally ordered than took another 30 minutes to come out. Took 3 bites of my food there was a hair battered into my shrimp pasta. Manager came over and asked to make another one... now why would I eat another one.  I&#39;ve lost all appetite. Also came there to celebrate my daughters birthday. Wasn&#39;t anything to rave about. Food was terrible to say the least and service I would give it a 3

this shit nasty af!! how my baby girls orange chicken have no sauce? and how was the fucking white rice drier then her pussy? huh? i need answers cause her shit dry af. but anyways why tf my waiter look like steve erkel? not gonna lie the bread was good af better than the food. and a nibba had to wait 40 min to get this nasty ass food. peace dawg
Same great good food may be better with a few more emoloyees. Everything clean and the service we received was pleasant

The cheesecake factory and I have a good relationship over the years.  I really come here more often on a drive by tip to get a fix of a few selected cheesecake slices on a take out mission.  Cheesecake factory works wonders when it comes to that.  Oh, the cheesecakes as many of you know are banging.  Sometimes it&#39;s testing your patience on weekend parking if you want to tolerate the traffic at the Cumberland mall.  If you choose to dine in, they have a gang of items on the menu.  I think the Cheesecake factory menu may be top 5 in NW Atlanta as far as depth on the menu from seafood, pasta, burgers, etc.  My favorite is their cajun jambalaya pasta.  I seem not to always go for that when I come here.  It is one of their favorites advertised.  The service is cool.  The energy and atmosphere is pretty good as well with versatility of the crowd.  Love the Buffalo meat appetizers as well with slammin flavored lemonade.  All cool with me. <br><br>Grade: B

Just had an amazing experience here... had drinks and dinner on the patio and Kaina was our server. She was so great! Timing was perfect! Couldn&#39;t ask for more. And the manager Rodney was a gem! He checked on us multiple times and was very attentive. We&#39;ll definitely be back!

RAW CHICKEN!  Don&#39;t go to this location.  I&#39;ve been to other locations with good service and food, but this one was a terrible experience.  The waitress even couldn&#39;t believe how one thing happened after another.  I was in a very good mood entering the restaurant with my wife, and we started with the Thai chicken lettuce wraps.  Biting into my second wrap the inside of the chicken was cold and slimy.  I knew it was raw, looked at the inside and it was very clear that it wasn&#39;t cooked.  The waitress apologized and comped the appetizer.  I had already ordered another chicken dish for the entree and was worried the same experience might happen.  Fortunately the entree was cooked right, but it didn&#39;t taste any different than KFC or Cracker Barrel&#39;s fried chicken that you can get for a fraction of the price.  Their other dishes are unique and have bold flavor, but the truffle honey fried chicken definitely is not.  I asked for some of the honey truffle glaze, so I could see what it tasted like, since I couldn&#39;t taste it on the plain fried chicken.  It took the kitchen too long to get it out and I thought they had forgotten about it as I tried waiting.  My wife was completely finished with her meal by the time they got it to me after I had to remind them again.  Sounded like it was the kitchens fault for not having it ready for the waitress.  The waitress comped our Cheesecake at the end of the meal, which was good and of course left us in a better mood since their cheesecakes are so good!  1 star for the location, but not the chain.
We ate at the Cheesecake factory yesterday. Despite being short staffed, because of Tropical Storm Irma, kudos to Drew, the bartender and Nicole, the manager, who made it all work.

Had dinner here on a week night with my daughter. The waiter was very attentive. The food was nothing memorable. I got a hamburger, it was ok. My daughter got a chicken pasta dish that could have easily fed 3 people. We both had plenty of leftovers, mine heated up just fine, when her pasta was reheated it was a greasy mess-gross! I think if they could cut the menu down, and focus on less items it would be much better. They are a little on the high side as far as pricing for the quality of the food, but the restaurant is beautiful and I will return.

The bartenders were friendly. However, I had to wait 25mims for my single order. It wasn&#39;t packed or busy. When I finally got my food the dish was cold but the plate was hot. I asked for a manager who offered to &#34;reheat&#34; my food and offered me a salad while I wait. I declined the salad and had toes it another 10mins for food. No discount was given for my time or inconvenience, not even a salad&#39;s worth. My time and hunger pains are precious. Keep the bread bring me my food in a timely manner.

Nothing outrageous, but always solid and dependable, and always something to hit the spot.  Good place when you can&#39;t decide what you are hungry for - crazy amount of choices.  Decent martinis too. Cheesecake Factory is definitely one of the best chain restaurants in my opinion. <br>Killer cheesecake if you have room left.

I usually don&#39;t review chain restaurants, but I decided that I needed to on this one.  First of all, the parking lot is always full and so hard to find a parking spot.  Valet for $6 may be the way to go.  Service was so slow, but friendly.  He took forever for our complimentary bread.  It came out with our entrees.<br><br>FOOD:  Cheesecake Factory always has enormous amounts of good food.  I had the Chinese Cashew Chicken Salad with a side of french fries with iced green tea.  The abundant mound of salad was full of lettuce, cashews, chicken with sprinkles of cilantro, sliced carrots, and sliced fried wontons.  This salad had a nice crunch added to the sweetness of the dressing.  The side of french fries were more like an order of fries for an entree.  The iced green tea had a refreshing minty taste to it.  Of course, we had the red velvet cheesecake which was a nice portion to share and a great ending to our meal.
We had a nice day out and decided to have lunch here.<br>The Meatloaf was good but the desserts are the best.

Customer Satisfaction!!!! On Friday (June 26th) my family and I celebrated my cousin&#39;s graduation. After patiently waiting for our party of 12 to be seated for close to 2 hours. The GM (Mike) gave everyone a free appetizer, non-alcoholic beverage, and slice of cheesecake for the inconvenience. This was all we needed to hold us over until the main course was ready at home. Our waitress Cassandra was friendly and attentive to the needs of our group. On behalf of my family thank you for making this celebration a success!!!
