Our server got much friendlier and attentive at the end of our meal but it was really too little, too late. The cheesecake as always was fantastic, however I think I will be getting my cheesecake to go from now on.

The five stars is for the cheesecake! My favorite is the oreo cheesecake.  Cookies throughout the entire pie and also the crust. It&#39;s a chocolate lover&#39;s din of sinful bliss. Love it love it love it. I&#39;ve eaten there before. I don&#39;t recommend that you get their pizza. It&#39;s expensive and ridiculously small for the price. You&#39;re better off using a coupon for domino&#39;s and getting more slices. also, the pizza doesn&#39;t taste all that great. It&#39;s like eating slime on a cardboard shingle. However, I&#39;ve had their burgers and those are awesome. My friends order the pasta dishes and seemed to love it. The complimentary bread and sweet butter is very tasty. I&#39;ve had great service thus far but of course I come mostly for the treats. I&#39;m happy that they cater to lots of different dietary needs. I&#39;m able to get a veggie burger which is mouthwatering and sumptious to say the least. You won&#39;t be disappointed in it. Parking is a drag on the weekends and for that reason I never go on the weekends in the cold months. I don&#39;t mind waiting in the cool breeze of the spring and summer evenings but I refuse to freeze my ass off in the blitzing cold. So, when spring shows it&#39;s lovely face, I show mine to the Cheesecake Factory to catch up on my dessert feast.
Dinner was great. The menu is huge and can make decisions difficult but worth it! Thai Chicken Pasta is awesome as well as Thai Lettuce Wraps.

All I can say is, &#34;Been there. Done that..., a number of times and at a number of their locations!&#34; This is still my go to place when I am with a party from the office or have family from out of town looking for a nice place for lunch. I love the Avocado Egg rolls, the Firecracker Salmon Rolls, the CRAB CAKES and the Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes, as appetizers. As mentioned, the &#39;Cajun&#39; Chicken Littles (not spicy to me - so don&#39;t be worried), as an entrée are wonderful and so plentiful that they will last for another two or three meals! I order the &#39;Sweet Hot Chili&#39; sauce for dipping, in lieu of the honey mustard or barbecue sauce they normally provide on the side. The Sweet Hot Chili sauce usually accompanies the Firecracker Salmon Rolls and is much preferred! It is so-o-o good, I could drink it!) The Steak Diane, Factory Meatloaf, Shepherd&#39;s Pie, Factory Burrito Grande and, did I mention the CRAB CAKES?, are top on my list. I have had a few of the pasta dishes and can not complain. I even enjoy their corn succotash and mashed potatoes. (GRIPE ALERT: I really wish the restaurants would peel the darn potatoes so I could enjoy the creamy texture and not find myself trying to elegantly rid myself of an offending, tough red skin that can not be chewed, or be forced to pick them out and segregate into a mini pile on my plate away from the potato itself.  Before you yell at me, yes, I know:  There is not really a way to elegantly rid yourself of the offending stuff once it is in your mouth.  Someone will always see!)<br><br>In terms of dessert, of course, I have sampled the cheesecake and they have all been wonderful. I typically prefer the entrée over a desert, but they still get the &#39;nod.&#39; Cheesecake Factory - Long may you reign!

I&#39;ve been here a couple of times now and all I can say is, Wow! The only problem I had was trying to figure out what I wanted to eat from the very large menu. Everything we had was really good. Make sure you save room for the namesake cheesecake. It is to die for.

My husband and I love to cook, but sometimes it gets late and we get lazy and we need a late-ish night spot to eat. The Cheesecake Factory at Cumberland Mall is close to our home, and they are open until 11:00 Monday - Thursday and even later on Friday and Saturday. If you&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory, you know they have a book for a menu. If you can&#39;t find something you like to eat here, you should probably look into joining Adult Picky Eaters Anonymous. They have everything. When a restaurant has such a huge variety of food, sometimes I am a little leery that  the food will lack focus and be missing on flavors. This is not the case at The Cheesecake Factory. I am always satisfied with my selection. One of my favorites is the French Country Salad that has roasted beets, asparagus, and goat cheese. It is quite tasty. I knocked off a couple of stars because of the atmosphere. The decor reminds me of a stationary cruise ship, and it&#39;s usually pretty noisy. the service is usually ok, but nothing spectacular. I am always tempted by the cheesecake selections, but I try to employ self-control and skip desert. I recently discovered that they have a split of Mumm Napa sparkling wine at a very reasonable price. This makes me very happy, and I often choose to have this as a liquid desert.

the service i get at this loaction is hit or miss. sometimes its good. sometimes its not, and that can happen at ANY restaurant, but overall its CF so we come for the buckwheat bread and the cheescake. my fav dish is terriyaki (sp) chicken boneless or the mahi with veggies. they have awesome sliders, and the orange chicken is good too.
